title: Aeronautical / Mechanical Engineer
description:
AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY

  • Develop engineering solutions for repairs & modifications of aircraft and clean power generation technologiesincluding: component & system conceptual design, 3D CAD models, manufacturing drawings, technical instructions, and engineering specifications.
  • Perform multi-disciplinary analysis of systems and components, based on initial skill set and ongoing training / development. This may include simulations for static stress, dynamics, aerodynamics, thermodynamics, electrical systems, and air/fluid systems.
  • Coordinate engineering projects to obtain certification of designs, including: project management, vendor/customer communications, testing programs, and preparation of required technical reports.
  • Maintain subject matter expertise in one or more of the following areas through active participation at conferences, trade shows, and various publications: structures, power and propulsion units, powertrain, dynamic components, hydraulic systems, avionics, additive manufacturing, metallurgical & manufacturing processes, analytical modeling, etc.
  • Streamline internal working procedures& and introduce mistake-proofing strategies through continuous development and automation

DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • B.Eng or M.Eng Degree in Mechanical Engineering (or equivalent) with 2-20 years experience
  • P.Eng License is preferred
  • Understanding of engineering drawing standards, including GD&T
  • Experience with analytical simulation tools (FE analysis, CFD, Heat Transfer, Electrical network, etc.)
  • Experience with Solidworks 3D CAD (or equivalent)
  • Experience with Power and Propulsion systems is preferred
  • Understanding of current trends in additive manufacturing & hybrid electric vehicles
  • Proficient with and has experience using advanced functions in MS office

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Passionate about aviation, green technology, and design innovation
  • Excellent communicator(verbal and written) who takes pleasure in submitting a well written report and a well prepared presentation
  • Comfortable with taking risks, receiving personal feedback, and sharing opportunities for improvement
  • Effortlessly creates analytical models (spreadsheets, codes, etc.) to solve complex problems
  • Able to take on many projects simultaneously and effectively prioritize work
  • Has personal integrity and empathy, who takes product performance and safety seriously, put doesn't take themselves too seriously
  • Enjoys travel and works effectively in a variety of work settings (office, customer/vendor on-site, trade shows, etc.)

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $75,000.00-$115,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Mechanical Design: 4 years (preferred)
  • Power and/or Propulsion: 4 years (preferred)
  • Project Management: 2 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • P.Eng License (preferred)
  • B.Eng Degree (or higher) (required)

title: Aeronautical Engineer Junior
description:
Position Overview:

Working with experienced engineers, the Junior Engineer will perform engineering tasks in support of fixed wing / rotary wing Aircraft Structural Integrity Programs (ASIP) and conducting structural analysis in support of aircraft modification programs.

Key Areas of Respomsibility:

  • Support the CP140 Aurora and/or CH149 Cormorant Aircraft Structural Integrity Programs (ASIP) including conducting data analysis;
  • Participate in aircraft modification design projects;
  • Participate in aircraft test programs;
  • Prepare software/database requirements, user instructions and testing documentation and Perform software testing according to prepared test scripts;
  • Design and substantiate non-standard repairs;
  • Perform structural analyses of repairs and modifications to aircraft structures;
  • Conduct Durability and Damage Tolerance Analyses (D/DTA) under the supervision of a senior D/DTA specialist;
  • Assist in the preparation of formal Reports and other engineering deliverables;
  • Other duties as tasked/required.

Position Requirements:

  • Bachelors or Masters degree in Aeronautical, Mechanical or Civil Engineering
  • Ability to work both independently and in a team environment
  • Willingness and enthusiasm to learn
  • Excellent oral, written and presentation skills
  • Knowledge of the MS Office and MS Windows environments
  • Experience with one or more of the following is not necessary but will be considered an asset:
    • Static analysis, fatigue analysis and fracture mechanics or finite element analysis
    • Collection, reduction, analysis and trending of engineering data
    • Statistical analysis
    • Design
    • Drafting
    • Testing
    • Computer programming and databases
  • Participate in Continuous Improvement activities in your area.
  • Incumbents must be able to pass and maintain Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) and Transport Canada security clearances.
  • The successful applicants will be eligible to meet requirements for the U.S International Traffic In Arms Regulations (ITAR), and Canadian Controlled Goods Program (CGP).
  • Applicants must be able to pass and maintain a Level II (Secret) security clearance with the Department of National Defence.

title: Jr. Aero/Mech Engineer
description:
IMP Aerospace is a leading Canadian aerospace company trusted by operators for its engineering and maintenance expertise in domestic and international military, government, original equipment manufacturers, and commercial environments. IMP Aerospace strives to be an exceptional service provider committed to customer satisfaction and growth through operational excellence, employee engagement, and diversification.

Position Overview:

Responsible to the Supervisor, CH149 Engineering, for the conduct of engineering support and life-cycle management of CH149 Cormorant airframe structures and/or mechanical systems. The Jr. Engineer will support Engineers and/or Life Cycle Specialists in repair design, monitoring of aircraft system performance and maintenance requirements, and the recommendation of improvements as necessary to optimize life-cycle costs.

The Jr. Aero/Mech Engineer will report to the IMP Group Ltd. – Aerospace and Defence location near the Halifax International Airport.

Key Areas of Responsibility:

  • Design and develop non-standard repairs for aircraft structures and/or mechanical systems.
  • Complete stress/structural analyses of repairs and modifications.
  • Monitor the health of mechanical components and systems within assigned Air Transport Association (ATA) chapter of responsibility.
  • Conduct activities associated with implementing and monitoring corrective action in regard to service difficulty reporting, special inspections, service bulletins and airworthiness directives.
  • Develop preventative measures, identify trends, and determine fleet impact on Flight Safety (FS) Occurrences.
  • Review and assess OEM design changes and provide recommendations to the Senior Design Engineer.
  • Inform the Senior Design Engineer of in-service issues that are determined to result in degradation to aircraft safety.
  • Coordinate the delivery of technical advice to maintenance personnel.
  • Conduct and support the assessment of airworthiness risk on the aircraft structure including preparation and review of Airworthiness Impact Assessments and Records of Airworthiness Risk Management.
  • Prepare and review engineering reports, technical memoranda and technical directions.
  • Provide support to the configuration management and data management activities of the department.
  • Support engineering projects and initiatives as requested.
  • Support the activities of the department in respect to maintenance program monitoring, maintenance rationalization, and maintenance requirements analysis.
  • Support identification of performance criteria/objectives for CH149 aircraft structures, in-service performance monitoring to these criteria, and technical investigations to identify and correct deficiencies or reduce life-cycle cost.
  • Amalgamate and analyze departmental performance data to support Key Performance Indicator tracking and implementation.
  • In extraordinary circumstances and when required by operational necessity, provide weekend and after-hours support to Search and Rescue Operations.
  • Other tasks as assigned.

Position Requirements:

  • B.Eng. or B.Sc. (Eng.) in Aeronautical or Mechanical Engineering.
  • Ability to work both independently and in a team environment.
  • Willingness and enthusiasm to learn.
  • Possess clear and effective written and oral communication skills.
  • Knowledge of the MS Office and MS Windows environments.
  • Experience with one or more of the following is not necessary but will be considered an asset:
    • Aircraft structures
    • Mechanical systems
    • Mechanical design
    • Composite structures
    • Computer programming and databases (i.e. SQL, VBA)
    • CAD
    • Additive manufacturing
    • Aircraft component manufacturing processes
    • Non-Destructive Testing and Inspection
    • Durability and Damage Tolerance Analysis
  • Sound interpersonal skills and an ability to work effectively with people at all levels, both within the organization and those in outside agencies.
  • Must be self-motivated and possess good self-discipline with an ability to work independently when required.
  • Must possess an ability to logically assimilate information and identify related causal factors, as well as to effectively prioritize multiple tasks.
  • Participate in Continuous Improvement activities in your area.
  • Incumbents must be able to pass and maintain Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) and Transport Canada security clearances.
  • The successful applicants will be eligible to meet requirements for the U.S International Traffic In Arms Regulations (ITAR), and Canadian Controlled Goods Program (CGP).
  • Applicants must be able to pass and maintain a Level II (Secret) security clearance with the Department of National Defence.

IMP is committed to Employment Equity and our goal is to be a diverse workforce that is representative at all job levels. We welcome applicants from Aboriginal People, Visible Minority Groups, Persons with Disabilities and Women in occupations of positions where they are under-represented. If you are a member of one of the equity groups, you are encouraged to self-identify on either your cover letter or resume.

title: Aeronautical / Aerospace Engineer
description:
JOB SUMMARY: The responsibility of an Aeronautical Engineer is to assist in ensuring aircraft maintenance repair
duties and Quality Assurance is carried out in accordance with the Clearwater Defense UH-60 Maintenance
Procedures and our UH-60 Quality Manual and any other applicable Company policies and procedures
pertaining to the UH-60/SH-60 Blackhawk/Seahawk.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Maintain Quality Assurance Program for the UH-60/SH-60 Helicopter
  • Working with AMCOM on new manuals and MEO’s
  • Certify and maintain maintenance processes and procedures on the UH-60/SH-60 Helicopter
  • Communicate with and support the Material Review Board, Transport Canada, FAA
  • Work closely with Transport Canada on the Research and Development of PMA parts
  • Assist in miscellaneous duties as directed
  • Maintain and ensure a safe working environment
  • Provide mentoring and direction to junior employees

ACCOUNTABILITY:

  • Contribute to the ongoing improvement of the UH-60/SH-60 Helicopter
  • Maintain the high morale and sense of shared direction of the Company
  • Project a positive image of your work and Company
  • A sense of ownership
  • Ongoing personal and professional growth

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Aeronautical/Aerospace Engineering
  • 2-3 years experience working with the UH-60 and/or SH-60 Helicopter
  • 2-3 years of Quality Assurance/Maintenance work on either UH-60 and/or SH-60 Helicopter
  • Candidate must speak fluent Spanish and English
  • High level of professionalism, maturity and confidence
  • Team oriented with creativity and ability to see projects through
  • Commitment to professional and personal growth
  • Highly efficient, effective and creative

To apply for this position please submit your resume and contact information to jobs@cwdsys.com quoting the
Job Title in the Subject line.

title: Base Engineer - Edmonton Base
description:
The Base Engineer is responsible for ensuring an aircraft operates properly and safely as well as for inspections and certifying an airplane of airworthiness standards.

  • Ensure that all maintenance assigned is accomplished in accordance with all applicable standards of airworthiness
  • Review all work assigned and coordinate the effective completion of that work
  • Ensure that all equipment used is in good working order and report those items that need repair
  • Supervise all maintenance personnel at the base
  • Ensure that all maintenance records required are complete and properly certified
  • Ensure that all aeronautical products maintained under his supervision have been certified in accordance with company standards
  • Ensure that the hangar, shops and offices are maintained in an acceptable manner
  • Ensure maintenance personnel are provided appropriate current reference material and special tools to effectively perform the tasks assigned
  • Review the computer due list daily, for Inspections and due items
  • Ensuring that the ALERT CARDS are up-to-date in the Journey log book
  • Responsible for checking the 12 month condensed due list monthly for major tasks coming due
  • Prepare the work orders for all due items and ensure that qualified personnel are assigned to the tasks
  • Ensuring that the work order has been completed correctly, signed out with the Engineer’s ACA stamp and/or signature, license number and date in the release section of the Task Card
  • Monitor Service Difficulty Reports
  • Check for Recurring Defects
  • Responsible for authorizing overtime or the use of Contract Labour

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application deadline: 2022-04-15

title: Senior Aircraft Engineer (Propulsion)
description:
Promaxis is searching for up to two (2) Senior Aircraft Engineers (Propulsion - Regulatory) to support the Department of National Defence (DND).

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Participate in accreditation and conduct audits (desk-top audits which are audits of documentation, and on-site audits which are audits carried out away from the normal place of duty) of organizations that are in the process of gaining technical airworthiness accreditation or that have already been accredited. Review process manuals and supporting documentation, assess processes for compliance to the Airworthiness Program Rules and Standards. Audit, review and assess nonstandard repairs and other design changes.
  • Develop, write, evaluate and edit AW documentation. Develop quality procedures, audit checklists and audit plans. Write observations and summarize findings within the applicable report to document non-compliances to the airworthiness program identified during the desktop and/or onsite audits. Evaluate the organization's proposed corrective action plan to address all non-compliances. Perform engineering analysis and develop non-standard repairs and modifications in applicable areas of expertise. Evaluate and write technical reviews of non-standard repairs, design changes and reports.
  • Proofread and verify documentation developed by others. Make recommendations and corrections to improve existing documentation.
  • Revise documentation. As required, suggest and provide amendments to update and improve documentation.
  • Evaluate, create, update or convert airworthiness training objectives, training standards and training material for traditional classroom based training, elearning / on-line training, and blended learning. Deliver airworthiness training. Develop, prepare and deliver briefing materiel to DND/CAF and industry personnel.
  • Investigate specific activities including but not limited to: design of aeronautical products, proposed modifications, failure modes, actual incidents of failure, test data, etc. In their specific area of expertise when conducting technical investigations, whether individually or as part of a team, provide support to stakeholders to facilitate their performance of airworthiness and technical functions.
  • Develop, participate in, update and conduct research associated with risk assessment, mitigation and tracking; individually or as part of a team.

Qualifications:

  • Language(s): English
  • Security Clearance: Valid Secret (Level II)

1. Must have an undergraduate or master’s degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in Aeronautical or Mechanical Engineering; OR, Must have an undergraduate or master’s degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in a science or engineering discipline, and specialized education as well as five (5) years of experience in the area of propulsion.

2. Must have completed engineering courses in three (3) or more of the following aircraft specialty areas:

  • Aero Gas Turbine Engine (GTE) design and performance;
  • Aircraft propulsion systems integration;
  • Aero GTE Prognostics and Health Management (PHM);
  • Aero GTE Health and Usage Monitoring Systems (HUMS);
  • Aero Propulsion Airworthiness Certification; or
  • Fuels and Lubricants.

3. Must have completed engineering courses in three (3) or more of the following aircraft specialty areas:

  • Turbomachinery component design, specifically to include lifing methodologies and technical considerations;
  • Development of engine specifications;
  • Aero GTE Prognostic and Health Management (PHM) methodologies;
  • GTE Health and Usage Monitoring Systems;
  • Aircraft fuel systems;
  • Auxiliary power units;
  • Engine accessory systems (e.g. fire-suppression, anti-icing);
  • Airframe integration;
  • Aeropropulsion control systems;
  • Propeller design and integration;
  • Helicopter main gearbox/transmission systems; or
  • Engine certification testing.

4. Must have a minimum of ten (10) years of experience, including at least five (5) years within the past eight (8) years, related to the design and/or engineering support of aircraft turbine engines, including engine installations for military or civilian turbo jet or turbo prop powered type aircraft or a mix of both.

5. Must have four (4) years of experience within the last seven (7) years in propulsion systems airworthiness certification against recognized civil or military standards, including review of design, work with basis of certification, work with certification plan, work with compliance programs and related compliance documentation.

6. Must provide details, including at least one (1) example, of work performed or formal education that clearly demonstrates knowledge in each of the following areas:

  • Aircraft turbine engine design principles, practices and current technology including engine installation, operation and maintenance;
  • Ground and flight test principles and practices as applied to aircraft engines; And
  • The application of airworthiness standards to propulsion system certification at the engine and aircraft levels.

Promaxis takes pride in valuing diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. Please notify any of our staff if you require any accommodations during the recruitment process. We would like to thank you for your interest in working for Promaxis; however, only those candidates that are under consideration will be contacted.

Promaxis is located in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $140,000.00-$164,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Gatineau, QC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Master's Degree (required)

Experience:

  • Aircraft Engineering: 10 years (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Secret (Level II) Security Clearance (required)

title: Engineer - Quality
description:
Job Title


Engineer – Quality


Department


Quality



Reports to


Director – Quality

Job Category


Salaried



Job Description



About MHI Canada Aerospace, Inc.

MHI Canada Aerospace, Inc. (MHICA), a group company of Mitsubishi Heavy Industries, is a Tier 1 manufacturer of major aircraft structures and assemblies, based in Mississauga, Ontario. Over the past decade, MHICA has built more than aircraft components, it has built a recognized worldwide reputation for capacity, precision, on-time delivery, and excellence. MHICA has two state-of-the-art facilities combined to 476,000 sq. ft. This comprises of Manufacturing & Assembly, Engineering, Quality and Supply Chain, where highly-skilled employees are working on Bombardier's sector-leading Global 5000/6000 and Challenger 350 business aircraft. MHICA's technicians build and join wing assemblies and fuselage sections, as well as perform systems and flight control assembly installations and testing.

Scope of Position



Reporting to the Director – Quality, the Engineer – Quality is responsible for driving strategic quality initiatives while working directly with both internal and external customers. This position will drive systemic quality improvement throughout MHICA. The Engineer – Quality identifies opportunities and provides leadership to make quality a competitive advantage for MHICA and its customers by participating in Continuous Improvement initiatives and maintaining / creating indicators to monitor Quality Improvement process.


Responsibilities also include:

  • Play a key role in customer audits, quality system audits, process product audits and effective corrective action closure.
  • Be a leader to identify and execute projects leading to process standardization and risk management, using standard techniques and processes (e.g. SIPOC, PFMEA, etc.).
  • Develops and maintains proactive MHICA quality requirements and quality focus attitude which translates customer quality needs in continuous quality process improvements.
  • Work closely with all functions to support Root Cause Analysis on internal/external issues, and work cross functionally to facilitate containment/closure of non-conformances.
  • Use software to track and monitor non-conformances data and participate in process improvements.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Skills and Qualifications


  • Proficient in the creation, review, and updating of quality process documents (inspection procedures and work instructions) and other specific documents in compliance with customer requirements quality standard AS 9100 and other statutory/regulatory requirements related to the product.
  • Experience in liaising with Customers on containment deployment and corrective actions.
  • Able to perform Configuration control and reconciliation.
  • Possesses knowledge and experience to review and approve production documentation issued by Methods.
  • Knowledge of statistical data analysis and problem solving methodologies.
  • Superior ability to read and understand technical drawings – GD&T.
  • Good decision-making skills and ability to interact with cross functional teams.
  • Ability to coordinate multiple projects at once.
  • Demonstrate strong skills in leadership, initiative, as well as teamwork.
  • Organized and able to work under pressure.
  • Ability and willingness to complete work on a fixed and demanding schedule and follow up on outstanding issues in a timely fashion.
  • Excellent planning skills, problem solving ability.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills and strong computer skills including MS Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Knowledge of Project Manager, Access and Visio a plus.

Experience


  • 3-5 years of experience in aerospace / automotive quality control / quality assurance with progressively increasing level of responsibility and demonstrated leadership role.
  • Experience and knowledge regarding structure assembly process related to machined aircraft components, sheet metal and aircraft assembly inspection requirements.
  • Previous experience with Quality Management System AS 9100 Rev C requirements and process / product audit.
  • Previous MRB experience preferred.

Education

title: Engineer, Systems – Airbus
description:
Description


Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.

We are seeking a highly skilled Systems Engineer to join the Air Canada Maintenance (ACM) Engineering Team. The qualified incumbent will be responsible for reliability and airworthiness of A320/A330 hydro-mechanical systems* together with support to Line and Airframe Maintenance for the assigned systems. In addition the candidate will support the different department within and outside of Air Canada Maintenance. This position will report to the Manager, System Engineering within ACM.

Key Functions & Accountabilities: (Responsibilities, Activities, Authority levels, etc)

  • Initiate and develop technical solutions to ensure aircraft system's performance meets corporate requirements for cost, reliability, and airworthiness

  • Review aircraft systems data and identify root cause of failure once in service

  • Develop cost effective engineering solutions with justification to reduce out-of-service events and to improve system reliability:

    • Raise request for financial approval

    • Develop in-house solution or embodiment of applicable Service Bulletin

    • Prepare engineering calculations and / or tests and related reports.

    • Recommend maintenance manuals revisions

    • Assess impact on aircraft maintenance program and systems configuration

  • Review and embodiment of Airworthiness Directives and Service Bulletins

  • Conduct technical investigations and prepare reports on incidents or accidents caused by malfunction or operational deviations

  • Provide engineering support (on and off work hours) to other departments including but not limited to:

    • Line Maintenance and Maintenance Control for troubleshooting on-wing systems problems

    • Airframe Maintenance during Heavy Maintenance events

    • Aircraft Programs for Entry into Service or aircraft returns

  • Liaise with OEM's (original equipment manufacturer), MRO's (maintenance repair organization) and Regulatory Agencies

  • Maintaining knowledge of Transport Canada regulations affecting area of expertise


* Air Conditioning, Flight Controls, Fuel, Hydraulic, Ice & Rain, Landing Gear, Oxygen, Pneumatic, Water/Waste

Qualifications


  • Bachelor of Engineering with a concentration in Mechanical or Aeronautical from a Canadian/Canadian recognized university (proof of equivalency required)

  • Several years of relevant experience (minimum of 6 years with eligibility to become a Transport Canada delegate) in aerospace industry mainly in managing hydro mechanical aircraft system

  • Candidates must be:

    • members or qualify for admission to a Provincial Engineering Association (Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec, Professional Engineers of Ontario, etc)

    • Eligible for or work towards a Transport Canada recognized delegation in the Systems specialty (Candidate Delegate/Delegate Engineer designation)

  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral in English - French is an asset

  • Willingness to be on call and to work flexible hours when needed

  • Ability to work without direct supervision, high sense of initiative

  • Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills.

  • Good familiarity with most commonly used PC-based software

  • Be able and available to travel where our aircraft modifications/repairs are performed.

Conditions of Employment:

  • Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position.

  • Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Required

Linguistic Requirements

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.



Diversity and Inclusion

Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees' unique contributions to our company's success.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted

title: Senior Aircraft Structures Engineer
description:
Promaxis is searching for up to three (3) Senior Aircraft Structures Engineers (Regulatory) to support the Department of National Defence (DND).

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Participate in accreditation and conduct audits (desk-top audits which are audits of documentation, and on-site audits which are audits carried out away from the normal place of duty) of organizations that are in the process of gaining technical airworthiness accreditation or that have already been accredited. Review process manuals and supporting documentation, assess processes for compliance to the Airworthiness Program Rules and Standards. Audit, review and assess nonstandard repairs and other design changes.
  • Develop, write, evaluate and edit AW documentation. Develop quality procedures, audit checklists and audit plans. Write observations and summarize findings within the applicable report to document non-compliances to the airworthiness program identified during the desktop and/or onsite audits. Evaluate the organization's proposed corrective action plan to address all non-compliances. Perform engineering analysis and develop non-standard repairs and modifications in applicable areas of expertise. Evaluate and write technical reviews of non-standard repairs, design changes and reports.
  • Proofread and verify documentation developed by others. Make recommendations and corrections to improve existing documentation.
  • Revise documentation. As required, suggest and provide amendments to update and improve documentation.
  • Evaluate, create, update or convert airworthiness training objectives, training standards and training material for traditional classroom based training, elearning / on-line training, and blended learning. Deliver airworthiness training. Develop, prepare and deliver briefing materiel to DND/CAF and industry personnel.
  • Investigate specific activities including but not limited to: design of aeronautical products, proposed modifications, failure modes, actual incidents of failure, test data, etc. In their specific area of expertise when conducting technical investigations, whether individually or as part of a team, provide support to stakeholders to facilitate their performance of airworthiness and technical functions.
  • Develop, participate in, update and conduct research associated with risk assessment, mitigation, and tracking; individually or as part of a team.

Qualifications:

  • Language(s): English
  • Security Clearance: Valid Secret (Level II)

1. Must have an undergraduate or a master’s degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in Aeronautical or Mechanical Engineering.

2. Must have a minimum of ten (10) years of experience within the past thirteen (13) years, related to aircraft structural engineering and/or performing certification work for aircraft structural designs.

3. Must have a minimum of two (2) years of experience within the last seven (7) years in aircraft structural systems airworthiness certification including review of design specifications, work with a Basis of Certification, work with a certification plan, work with compliance programs and related compliance documentation. Must have experience in at least six (6) of the following:

  • Aircraft structure design;
  • Loads development;
  • Stress analysis (static, fatigue and damage tolerance analysis);
  • Fatigue testing;
  • Structural dynamics;
  • Aircraft structural integrity management;
  • Full scale testing and teardown;
  • Design, evaluation and exploitation of the Finite Element Model (FEM);
  • Aircraft structural repair design;
  • Manufacture or maintenance of aircraft structural systems; or
  • Certification of aircraft structure.

Promaxis takes pride in valuing diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. Please notify any of our staff if you require any accommodations during the recruitment process. We would like to thank you for your interest in working for Promaxis; however, only those candidates that are under consideration will be contacted.

Promaxis is located in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $140,000.00-$164,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Gatineau, QC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Master's Degree (required)

Experience:

  • Aircraft Engineering: 5 years (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Secret (Level II) Security Clearance (required)

title: Airworthiness Engineer
description:
Job Summary:

The principal responsibilities of the Airworthiness Engineer are to manage and coordinate all activities relating to the type design approvals for Diamond products. This includes new development programs, continuing airworthiness activities and production support. This position is the primary contact with Transport Canada Civil Aviation (TCCA) and all other foreign authorities.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist in the preparation of airworthiness compliance reports and certification plans.
  • Review design and certification methods to ensure that the products will be certified in an efficient and complete manner.
  • Liaise with Engineering, production and Customer Support to manage projects and issues.
  • Provide design guidance to Specialists relating to methods of compliance.
  • Track and document issues, reports and actions.
  • Coordinate submission of Compliance Data.
  • Perform and coordinate certification activities for new aircraft types or changes to Type Design (design changes, Airplane Flight Manual, Airworthiness Limitations) with Transport Canada and foreign Airworthiness authorities.
  • Negotiate and gain agreement with authorities related to interpretation of requirements.
  • Liaise with TCCA on Programs, interfacing and focal point for all communication relating to aircraft certification and continuing airworthiness between the company and the Airworthiness authorities.
  • Manage issues, actions and reports for all activities.
  • Control TCCA LOI.
  • Participate in the engineering change board.
  • Perform all work in accordance with Health and Safety policies.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Engineering degree or equivalent.
  • Understanding of basic engineering and design principles.
  • Basic Understanding of aeronautical regulations and guidance material.
  • Familiar with aerospace products and processes.
  • Proficient in PC use; including Microsoft Office, PowerPoint, Project. Applications and AutoCAD.
  • Strives to achieve a high level of quality and productivity.
  • Ability to produce clear and comprehensive written procedures and reports.
  • Proactive thinker and creative.
  • Ability to work under minimal supervision.
  • Must be a team player and a person with initiative, strong sense of responsibility & good judgment.
  • Must be highly adaptable to effectively deal with changes.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Beneficial Experience:

  • Previous experience as a Certification or Airworthiness Engineer.
  • Experience in working with Aviation Regulations and guidance material.
  • Experience in the engineering and design of aeronautical products.
  • Experience with new product development.
  • Experience working with Transport Canada , the FAA and EASA.
  • Delegation from an Aviation Authority.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Do you have Engineering degree or equivalent?

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

title: Senior Propulsion Engineer - Jet Engine Development
description:
Specific Job Description

  • Leads engineering support to the test cell department; provide instructions for engine troubleshooting in the test cell; analysis of failed engines; communicate with vendor for test cell maintenance; support/drive correlation for engine models
  • Analysis of engines test data, calculation of performance parameters such as thrust cell factor, vibration levels and core airflow using calibrated first turbine nozzle method with hands on experience on various engines Air Transport Association’s (ATA’s) classification, Life limited parts and various engines components (such as the High Pressure Compressor (HPC), Low Pressure Turbine (LPT), No4 Bearing, Blades and Vanes)
  • Provides technical support and troubleshooting assistance during engine strip and build on CF34/CFM56/CF6 engine line while leading and approving work scope preparation and release
  • Responsible for addressing and resolving Material Review Board (MRB) requests and other engineering snags respecting engines operations schedule and turnaround time deadlines
  • Leads the analysis of engine’s components damage tolerance, durability, design allowables and structural modelling of engines components including testing. Specific engineering specialties may include structural dynamics, simulation, burst margin, stability and stress fatigue and thermal analysis. Tools utilized may include Finite Element Method (FEM) modelling, CATIA, IDEAS, ProEngineer
  • Experience with aircraft propulsion and engine systems and troubleshooting, holds, eligible for, or work towards, Power Plant Design Engineer (DE)/Design Engineer Specialist (DES) designation, Transport Canada (TC) or Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) delegate/designee or Design Approval Representative (DAR) or Designated Engineering Representative (DER) is an asset
  • Technical liaison with the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) on any shop related issues
  • Liaise with the Customer Representative on any customer requests
  • Prepare customized shop visit reports; initial findings or investigation engines a required
  • Create and present customer technical presentations for Quarterly Review Meetings (QRMs) with the customer
  • Develop and maintain the Lockheed Martin Commercial Engine Solutions (LMCES) Workscope Planning Guide documents
  • Manage Service Bulletin review process
  • Provide support to the Configuration Control Specialist during the publication review process
  • Develop and maintain engine workscoping tasks in Quantum Control
  • Lead in the financial analysis and cost reduction initiatives
  • Designs or recommends new or modified parts and components (Parts Manufacturer Approval (PMA)/DER); Certification of engine parts by testing & analysis meeting airworthiness authorities’ requirements (Transport Canada Civil Aviation (TCCA), FAA & European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA)); Directs establishment of structural specifications, performance of stress analysis and performance testing.

Employee Type

Full Time

Vacancy Type

Permanent

Business Environment

Lockheed Martin Canada is the Canadian-based arm of Lockheed Martin Corporation, a global security and aerospace company employing 110,000 people worldwide, including more than 1,000 Canadians. By applying innovative approaches of our highly skilled and experienced Canadian workforce, we have been Canada’s trusted defence and aerospace partner for over 80 years. We operate major facilities in Ottawa, Montreal, Halifax, Calgary and Victoria and work on a wide range of programs from advanced naval technology products and unmanned systems software to providing delivery and in-service support of the latest military aircraft to commercial engine repair and overhaul capabilities. This position is part of the Lockheed Martin Commercial Engines Solutions team within our world-class facility in Montreal, where approximately 300 employees engage in comprehensive engine maintenance, repair and overhaul, as well as customized engine builds for military and commercial operators.

Required skills, qualifications and experience

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Aeronautical, Materials Engineering degree
  • Minimum of 10 years of technical experience in similar position, or equivalent experience in aircraft engines development and Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO), Test cell experience is considered an asset
  • Hands on experience in handling technical aspects of MRO and troubleshooting of aircraft engines and components in an engine shop
  • Fleet experience on propulsion, Gas Turbine engine systems and components repair procedures, failure mechanisms, investigations, findings and corrective actions
  • Experience on engine ATA 72 with know-how on components (Life Limited Parts (LLPs), Fan frame, HPC, High Pressure Turbine (HPT), LPT, Exhaust, Line Replaceable Units (LRUs) & accessories) functionality, inspection as well as failure modes and corrections
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Proven ability to conduct investigations & root cause analysis, develop engineering procedures and technical reports, MRB & Snags corrective actions and recommend manual revisions
  • Engineering judgment, initiative and ability to work with minimum supervision
  • Willingness to be on call and to work extended hours including weekends
  • Ability to summarize, Organizational planning and Problem solver
  • Organizational skills and Tolerance to Stress
  • Excellent knowledge in Microsoft Office
  • Fluent in French and English.

Desired skills, qualifications and experience

  • Quantum Control experience is an asset
  • Experience in handling technical aspects of maintenance repairs of aero engines in an MRO is an asset
  • Experience in handling and troubleshooting engine problems is an asset.

Workplace Vaccination Policy

Lockheed Martin Canada is committed to lead and support efforts to ensure a safe and healthy work environment for our employees, partners and customers. Our Workplace Vaccination policy provides direction on our approach to managing COVID-19 and that policy will likely evolve as conditions and legal requirements change. At this time, all current and future employees of Lockheed Martin Canada who work on certain federal government sites must be fully vaccinated. We are also asking all employees to voluntarily submit their current vaccine status.

Equal Opportunity Statement

Lockheed Martin Canada is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. We are committed to excellence in serving all customers, including people with disabilities, and we encourage feedback on the provision of these services.

title: Senior Aircraft Life Support Equipment Engineer
description:
Promaxis is searching for a Senior Aircraft Life Support Equipment Engineer to support the Department of National Defence (DND).

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Participate in accreditation and conduct audits (desk-top audits which are audits of documentation, and on-site audits which are audits carried out away from the normal place of duty) of organizations that are in the process of gaining technical airworthiness accreditation or that have already been accredited. Review process manuals and supporting documentation, assess processes for compliance to the Airworthiness Program Rules and Standards. Audit, review and assess nonstandard repairs and other design changes.
  • Develop, write, evaluate and edit AW documentation. Develop quality procedures, audit checklists and audit plans. Write observations and summarize findings within the applicable report to document non-compliances to the airworthiness program identified during the desktop and/or onsite audits. Evaluate the organization's proposed corrective action plan to address all non-compliances. Perform engineering analysis and develop non-standard repairs and modifications in applicable areas of expertise. Evaluate and write technical reviews of non-standard repairs, design changes and reports.
  • Proofread and verify documentation developed by others. Make recommendations and corrections to improve existing documentation.
  • Revise documentation. As required, suggest and provide amendments to update and improve documentation.
  • Evaluate, create, update or convert airworthiness training objectives, training standards and training material for traditional classroom based training, elearning / on-line training, and blended learning. Deliver airworthiness training. Develop, prepare and deliver briefing materiel to DND/CAF and industry personnel.
  • Investigate specific activities including but not limited to: design of aeronautical products, proposed modifications, failure modes, actual incidents of failure, test data, etc. In their specific area of expertise when conducting technical investigations, whether individually or as part of a team, provide support to stakeholders to facilitate their performance of airworthiness and technical functions.
  • Develop, participate in, update and conduct research associated with risk assessment, mitigation and tracking; individually or as part of a team.

Qualifications:

  • Language(s): English
  • Security Clearance: Valid Secret (Level II)

1. Must have a degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in a field of engineering, science, or mathematics; OR Must have obtained the rank of Capt or above within the Aerospace Engineering Officer (AERE) classification within the CAF.

2. Must have a minimum of three (3) years of demonstrated experience with ALSE within the last ten (10) years and provide details to include a minimum of one (1) example of work performed or formal education that demonstrates experience and knowledge in a minimum of seven (7) of the following subject areas:

  • Aviation oxygen systems (e.g. Gaseous Oxygen Cylinders; Oxygen Regulators; Oxygen System Plumbing/Test equipment; Liquid Oxygen (LOX) Converter; Emergency Oxygen Systems (portable and hard mounted); Oxygen Masks; Chemical Oxygen);
  • Cryogenic Equipment (Oxygen Servicing Unit, LOX Servicing Trailers, LOX sampler, purging unit, gaseous oxygen trailers, cleaning cart, servicing clothing and facilities);
  • Ejection Seat, Sequencing System and Rocket (aircraft pyrotechnics devices);
  • Human rated parachutes, including Search and Rescue (CSAR-7), troop, ejection seat and Aircrew Emergency Parachutes Systems;
  • Restraint harnesses (e.g. crew harness, hoisting, ejection seat);
  • Aircrew & Passenger Life Preservers/Survival Vests (also Slim Line Back Pack) and associated Automatic Inflation Device (AID);
  • Aircrew clothing, including immersion garments and cooling garments;
  • Aircrew helmets, including night vision goggle integration and laser visors;
  • Anti-G garments and related human factors considerations;
  • Life rafts and associated equipment (including AID);
  • Emergency Breathing System (EBS);
  • First Aid Kits, Survival Kits & containers;
  • Hazardous Cargo Kit;
  • Nuclear Biological Chemical (NBC) Respirator and/or Aircrew Chemical Defence Ventilator System (ACDVS);
  • NBC Equipment, Liquid & Vapour Protection Garment & Chemical Defence Individual Protection Equipment;
  • SAR equipment, including litters (for hoisting), air-droppable kits, equipment delivery systems (parachute, hoist-lowered), descent devices (e.g. Anthron);
  • Cargo Extraction Parachute Systems (cargo, drift, extraction system);
  • Aerial Delivery Parachutes and Equipment (pallets, platforms, nets, containers, slings; safety restraints; rigging procedures); or
  • AMSE (Electrical, Hydraulic, Oxygen/Nitrogen, Air Start Cart).

3. Must have a minimum of one (1) example of work performed within the past ten (10) years for a minimum of two (2) of the following three (3) areas:

  • Design Change Management - This can only include work related to the development, review or approval of aircraft design changes and management the configuration records associated with this activity;
  • Development and Implementation of Quality System Procedures. - This must include writing, reviewing or approval of quality documentation used in the engineering or technical support organization; and/or
  • Project Management - This includes actual work performed related to project planning, defining project tasks and schedule, project plan execution and project control.

Promaxis takes pride in valuing diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. Please notify any of our staff if you require any accommodations during the recruitment process. We would like to thank you for your interest in working for Promaxis; however, only those candidates that are under consideration will be contacted.

Promaxis is located in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $140,000.00-$164,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Gatineau, QC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Secret (Level II) Security Clearance (required)

title: Aerospace Structure Engineer
description:
Polytech Aero Support Inc. offers a wide variety of aeronautical services to independent aircraft operators, airlines and aeronautical products manufacturers worldwide. The company provides Turn Key Modification Design and Certification Engineering Package; Complete Cabin and IFE Retrofit Engineering Package; Complete VIP and VVIP interiors retrofit, Airline Technical and Engineering Services; Maintenance and Flight Operations Consulting; Engine and Aircraft Performance and Health Monitoring; Aircraft Weighing Services; Fuel Conservation Monitoring; Other Customized Airline Support.

The Aerospace Structural Engineer performs various engineering tasks related to aircraft structures.

Under the Engineering Certification Manager your main responsibilities will will include:

  • Review the structural work performed on the aircraft and ensure it is within the acceptable margins.
  • Validate and enter all structural repairs performed on aircraft in to the internal database.
  • Help with the development of aircraft interior parts.
  • Structurally analyze components for installation on the aircraft.
  • Draft stress reports.
  • Support the engineering department as required.

Preferred Qualifications And/or Education

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or equivalent experience in a related field.
  • 3-10 years of experience working in a similar role.
  • Experience with designing, manufacturing and analyzing aircraft components, systems and interiors.
  • Experience working with TCCA, FAA or EASA.
  • In-depth working knowledge of Microsoft Office.
  • Knowledge of airframe manufacturer requirements for cabin interiors including emergency landing conditions, HIC etc. - desired.
  • Knowledge of airframe manufacturer NDT and SRM manuals.

Soft Skills

  • Ability to both interact with a team and work independently with high initiative
  • Ability to efficiently resolve problems
  • Ability to adapt, plan and organize in a constantly changing environment
  • Strong written and verbal English communication skills
  • Strong analytical problem solving skills
  • Ability to work independently with minimal direction as well as in a team environment
  • Must be proactive, meticulous, organized and detail-oriented
  • Ability to use discretion and independent judgment when making decisions on behalf of the company

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Fixed term contract

Salary: $50,000.00-$75,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Are you familiar with aircraft documentation? SRM, NDT, AMM, IPC etc.
  • Are you currently located in the province of Quebec?

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • aircraft structural engineering: 2 years (required)

title: Tooling Engineer - Jet Engine MRO
description:
Specific Job Description

Lockheed Martin is seeking a Tooling and Materials Engineer who will be responsible for the concept, design and documentation of manufacturing tooling and equipment required to effect manufacturing processes in accordance with production rate requirements providing support to Jet Engine overhaul and components repair engineering. The engineer is responsible for the design & manufacture of tooling & fixturing to support the repair and manufacturing of engine components, through CNC machining, inspection and assembly operations.

The candidate will work within the Engineering & Quality organization with the following mandates:
  • Designs, sketches, analyzes and fabricates tooling, machines, jigs & fixtures needs for the various engine & components Repair and Overhaul (MRO) programs.
  • Determines requirements for tools/machines needed in all areas of the plant while meeting the program cost and schedule requirements
  • Creates Two Dimensional (2D) and Three Dimensional (3D) sketches, review drawings, designs for manufacturability and perform stress analysis calculations on tooling designs. Develop and implement interim solutions for damaged and unsafe equipment and tooling
  • Works with machine shops to have tools fabricated and with Operations to proof new tools
  • Creates fully detailed Computer-Aided Design (CAD) model components, assemblies, fully toleranced and annotated 2D drawings for manufacturing, inspection, calibration and assembly activities in the repair shop
  • Creates and maintain related documentation for equipment and tooling, develops preventative maintenance plans and trains personnel as needed
  • Provide technical liaison with outside vendors on Tooling issues
  • Designs, develops and implements industrial machinery and equipment, tools, dies, gauges, jigs, fixtures, prototype model production and machine attachments required for production or experimental use, considering such factors as accessibility, economy, mobility, and performance requirements. May use CAD/Computer-Aided Manufacturing (CAM) to design tools
  • Experience in setting up and operating a variety of machine tools such as lathes, milling machines, shapers, planers, and precision grinders to make metal parts, mechanisms, tools, or machines to exacting tolerances and dimensions
  • Qualified in using a variety of machinist's hand tools and precision measuring instruments; makes standard shop computations relating to dimensions of work, tooling, feeds, and speeds; measures, marks, and scribes dimensions and reference points to lay out stock for machining; fits and assembles precision parts into mechanical equipment and determines material, parts, and equipment required. May modify numerically controlled programs on Numerically Controlled (NC) machines
  • Lays out, fabricates, and assembles metalworking dies, molds, and machine tool fixtures by analyzing blueprints, sketches, models, and engineering or shop specifications. Uses a variety of machinist's hand tools and precision measuring instruments. Computes dimensions; determines machining and material or parts required.

Employee Type

Full Time

Vacancy Type

Permanent

Business Environment

Lockheed Martin Canada is the Canadian-based arm of Lockheed Martin Corporation, a global security and aerospace company employing 110,000 people worldwide, including more than 1,000 Canadians. By applying innovative approaches of our highly skilled and experienced Canadian workforce, we have been Canada’s trusted defence and aerospace partner for over 80 years. We operate major facilities in Ottawa, Montreal, Halifax, Calgary and Victoria and work on a wide range of programs from advanced naval technology products and unmanned systems software to providing delivery and in-service support of the latest military aircraft to commercial engine repair and overhaul capabilities. This position is part of the Lockheed Martin Commercial Engines Solutions team within our world-class facility in Montreal, where approximately 300 employees engage in comprehensive engine maintenance, repair and overhaul, as well as customized engine builds for military and commercial operators.

Required skills, qualifications and experience

  • Mechanical, Aeronautical, Materials, Manufacturing or equivalent Engineering Degree from accredited university 5 years minimum relevant experience or equivalent
  • Experience in a manufacturing environment. Jet Engine experience is considered an asset
  • Hands-on experience in computer aided design software. Proficiency with Pro-Engineer, CATIA (or comparable) CAD System
  • Demonstrated experience in machine / tool mechanical design
  • Previous experience in engineering materials and general manufacturing processes
  • Microsoft Office proficiency - Excel, Word, Power Point, etc.
  • Experience with drawing software and the various symbols, perspectives, units of measurement, notation systems, visual styles and page layouts used in technical drawings
  • Ability to interpret complex engineering drawings. Demonstrated hands-on mechanical ability
  • Proven ability to support investigations, prepare technical reports and recommendations
  • Organizational skills and tolerance to stress
  • Knowledge of special processes: water jet, plasma, SDM, EDS, shot peening, welding, cleaning systems
  • Be customer focused and result driven.

Workplace Vaccination Policy

Lockheed Martin Canada is committed to lead and support efforts to ensure a safe and healthy work environment for our employees, partners and customers. Our Workplace Vaccination policy provides direction on our approach to managing COVID-19 and that policy will likely evolve as conditions and legal requirements change. At this time, all current and future employees of Lockheed Martin Canada who work on certain federal government sites must be fully vaccinated. We are also asking all employees to voluntarily submit their current vaccine status.

Equal Opportunity Statement

Lockheed Martin Canada is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. We are committed to excellence in serving all customers, including people with disabilities, and we encourage feedback on the provision of these services.

title: System Engineer
description:
For those who dream of advancing our space in the Universe and on Earth, we’ll take you there.

Serving the world from our Canadian home and our global offices, MDA is an international space mission partner and robotics & space operations, satellite systems and geointelligence pioneer with a 50-year story of firsts on and above the Earth. Today, we're leading the charge towards viable Moon colonies, enhanced Earth observation, communication in a hyper-connected world, and more.

We’re fueled by a pioneering spirit that carries us beyond. And together we enable highly skilled people to continually push boundaries and tackle big challenges requiring solutions that endure and inspire.

Are you ready to launch the next stage of your career in the new space economy? We would love to hear from you!

We’re on the hunt for an System Engineer in our Geointelligence Engineering Team at our Richmond or Ottawa office.

Our mission is to turn data into insight. From detecting changes in fragile ecosystems to monitoring northern ice floes and shipping routes, our near-real time data of Earth observation and the environment makes our Geointelligence team a leader in geospatial imagery, ground stations, enterprise geospatial systems and defence programs.

As a member of the Engineering team you will work on our programs such as Chorus Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) Satellite, Canadian Surface Combatant (CSC), Square Kilometer Array (SKA) radio telescope, Aeronautical Navigation products, and Marine Insights products. You will work as part of a technical team to develop new capabilities, enhance existing capabilities and deliver solutions to our customers.

As part of your growth and development we will work with you to establish your development actions alongside regular progress reviews. You are likely to move through various projects to gain the experience and knowledge to progress your career with us.


The systems engineering team is structured to be flexible and able to respond and evolve with the program needs.

The successful candidate’s first assignment would be as part of a dynamic systems engineering team that will mature the CSC Electronic Warfare (EW) system design and support procurement of EW subsystems through all design phases, Factory Acceptance Testing, Integration, Set-to-Work and final acceptance trials.

Excellent internal and external communication are necessary in order to work closely within our distributed team, our customer and their technical teams, our suppliers, and other external stakeholders.

The successful candidate will have an aptitude to mature their systems engineering experience, EW systems knowledge, and operational mission awareness. Interest, experience and/or background in the maritime and/or naval domain would be an asset. The successful candidate will be an integral part of an engineering team, under the direction of the Program Engineer, EW IPT Lead, and Systems Engineering Lead. Junior and intermediate systems engineers will have the opportunity to be mentored by the senior engineers on the team.

We are looking are people to be based in either Richmond, BC or Ottawa, ON.


Responsibilities could include:

  • Performs the engineering functions for highly complex systems:
    • Supports the development and maintenance of requirements from the ship level down through the EW subsystem levels. This will done through a mix of traditional engineering and MBSE approaches, including capturing the outputs in a SysML modelling environment.
    • Supporting the development and generation of documents such as, design reports, technical deliverables. Our team will need to support the full scope of system engineering aspects including compatibility and interoperability, human factors, cyber-security, modelling and simulation, ILS, and verification and testing.
    • Analyzes and develops specific EW solutions to current and emerging threats.
    • Defines and maintains interfaces between the EW subsystems and the ship platform, including the combat management system, above water systems, and mast design.
    • Support and/or generate of models to simulate system performance and RF interference / integration into mission platform and other platform sensors.
    • Support human factors engineering in the definition of how the EW systems are used by naval operators.
    • Supports system/product integration.
    • Verifies and validates system designs to ensure conformance with functional specifications and customer requirements.
  • Supports planning and cost estimates for Engineering Change Proposals and program phase/task proposals.
  • Develop relationships and engage with clients technical team and SMEs
  • Support the EW supplier procurements through the subcontracts manager. This could include engaging with our supplier technical teams and SMEs, reviewing subcontractor documentation, and trade-off studies.

Experience and skill requirements:

  • Experience working in well-structured systems engineering teams
  • Experience with modern Requirements Management Techniques
  • Experience in large Electronic Systems Development or Integration projects
  • A strong understanding of project execution processes from requirements through commissioning and support.
  • Display creativity in meeting performance requirements and established quality standards in the context of project constraints.
  • Experience maintaining close working relationships with other system engineers and customer representatives in a location distributed environment.
  • Must have excellent verbal and written communications and customer interaction skills.
  • Exceptional leadership skills, problem solving abilities and project execution strengths.

Preferred experience and skills:

  • Experience in Model Based Systems Engineering
  • Experience with the design and development of Electronic Warfare systems.
  • Experience with the design and development of maritime and/or naval systems, including environment qualification, human factors, and maritime certifications.
  • Knowledge of advanced antenna technologies and performance.
  • Experience with antenna performance and atmospheric RF propagation modelling.
  • Understanding of Radar and Missile System employment and capabilities.
  • Understanding of Radar and Laser Warning Receivers, SIGINT sensors, countermeasure systems and signal processing techniques.
  • Familiar with EW hardware architectures including DRFM.
  • Understanding of installation considerations including EMI/EMC, etc.
  • Knowledge of COMINT is desirable.
  • Experience working with engineering tools such as DOORS and CAMEO.

Education:

  • A University degree in Engineering, Physics or related field from an accredited institution.
  • Post Graduate degree preferred.

We’re a dream team of purpose-driven, collaborative and passionate people, and we are constantly looking for others to join #TeamMDA to ignite new and innovative approaches to problem-solving that push us forward to improve life on and above Earth. If you’re excited to expand our place in space and driven to inspire the next generation, we’ll take you there.

We have entered a new era of exploration and development, and MDA welcomes all who yearn to suit up and be part of it. An equal opportunity employer prizing diversity, integrity and collaboration, we are committed to growing MDA’s and Canada’s leadership in this next golden age.

Comments/Special Considerations:

Successful candidates must obtain and hold security clearance at the reliability status level, and pass security assessment for the Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and ITAR.

MDA provides competitive compensation and benefits packages for its employees at all locations. As a team member of MDA, you and your qualified dependents are eligible to participate in a benefit plan that ensures a comprehensive level of protection through competitive health care including; extended healthcare and flexible drug plans, dental and vision benefits, disability income protection, life insurance, group retirement savings plans; and an employee and family assistance program.

MDA is an equal opportunity employer prizing diversity and inclusion. We are committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity. If you require assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please feel free to notify us.

With a priority on maintaining the safety of our employees, customers and communities, MDA has implemented a mandatory vaccination policy for employees and visitors. Please speak to a recruiter for more details.

title: newAirworthiness Engineer
description:
The Organization
De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. (‘DHC’) is a proudly Canadian aerospace company currently transitioning its corporate headquarters to Calgary, AB. DHC is undertaking a consolidation of its underlying subsidiary companies under a single brand currently offering engineering, aftermarket, new aircraft manufacturing, modifications, parts manufacturing and flight training. DHC currently has approximately 1,200 employees based in BC, AB and ON as well as in markets and distribution hubs world-wide. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, quality and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed in an organization with a proud heritage and bright future.

*
Profile*
The* Airworthiness Engineer *reports to the Airworthiness Manager and works closely with the Design Engineering group, Technical Publications group and the Technical Support group.

*
Location*
This position is located on-site in Calgary, AB, Toronto, ON, or Victoria, BC.

*
Duties & Responsibilities*

  • Coordinate with engineering to obtain design approval of changes to the Type Design, including design modifications, repairs, flight manual changes, and Airworthiness Limitation changes.
  • Support the investigation and establishment of corrective actions for issues affecting the design compliance and/or safety of the aircraft as a whole or for any component, system or structural assembly.
  • Facilitate discussions and agreements with Authorities on certification and product integrity activities, developing appropriate strategies and direction with Engineering and other technical groups.
  • Support the company in fulfilling responsibilities of the Design Approval Organization and Design Approval Document Holder.
  • Research through Service Difficulties Reports, accident/incident information, engineering substantiation reports, manufacturing information, historical sales/warranty/other, and operator's report.
  • Complete safety risk assessments, in conjunction with engineering and technical support groups, to record the technical information and potential risk of safety related events.
  • Initiate and oversea corrective action plans that require a design change and support the Design lead.
  • Maintain adherence to engineering and Design Approval Organization practices when executing design changes.
  • Work with the Maintenance Program Group and Technical Publications to develop changes to the Approved Manuals and ICAs.
  • Development and completion of Changed Product Rule assessments.
  • Preparation and management of certification plans and compliance programs.
  • Act as a focal for all communication relating to aircraft certification between the company and the Airworthiness Authorities.
  • Coordination of Airworthiness Authority involvement and acceptance of certification documents and activities.
  • Develop, lead, and maintain adherence to certification action plans.
  • Identify certification risk and develop appropriate responses.
  • Provide advice and strategies to management and specialists on regulatory matters.

*
Education & Professional Qualifications*

  • Bachelor's degree in aerospace or mechanical engineering, or a combination of equivalent education and experience, or;
  • Graduation from a recognized college with mechanical engineering or aeronautics diploma with at least two-years' experience in either maintenance, safety data analysis, or equivalent experience relevant to design certification.

*
Experience*

  • Minimum 10 years' experience in the aeronautical industry is an asset.
  • Previous work experience with Transport Canada Civil Aviation, Aircraft Certification Branch is an asset.
  • Previous work experience within a DAO, or equivalent, is an asset.

*
Skills*

*
Excellent working knowledge of regulatory requirements and certification practices related to aircraft design approval

  • Ability to read engineering technical information, including technical drawings and production documentation.
  • Excellent written communication skills.
  • Excellent organizational skills, high ability to multitask, and work independently with minimum direct supervision.
  • Strong analytical skills and business acumen.
  • Team player with a strong sense of initiative, responsibility, and good judgment.
  • Able to manage several concurrent projects and meet tight deadlines.
  • Able to think quickly and creatively in a fast-moving and changing business context.
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.

_
At De Havilland Canada, we aim to be inclusive and diverse and provide equal opportunity for employment. All qualified applicants, regardless of gender, age, race, religion, sexual orientation and disability, are encouraged to apply._

KW4nyCfZ45

title: Senior Aircraft Engineer (Mechanical Systems)
description:
Promaxis is searching for up to two (2) Senior Aircraft Engineers (Mechanical Systems - Regulatory) to support the Department of National Defence (DND).

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Participate in accreditation and conduct audits (desk-top audits which are audits of documentation, and on-site audits which are audits carried out away from the normal place of duty) of organizations that are in the process of gaining technical airworthiness accreditation or that have already been accredited. Review process manuals and supporting documentation, assess processes for compliance to the Airworthiness Program Rules and Standards. Audit, review and assess nonstandard repairs and other design changes.
  • Develop, write, evaluate and edit AW documentation. Develop quality procedures, audit checklists and audit plans. Write observations and summarize findings within the applicable report to document non-compliances to the airworthiness program identified during the desktop and/or onsite audits. Evaluate the organization's proposed corrective action plan to address all non-compliances. Perform engineering analysis and develop non-standard repairs and modifications in applicable areas of expertise. Evaluate and write technical reviews of non-standard repairs, design changes and reports.
  • Proofread and verify documentation developed by others. Make recommendations and corrections to improve existing documentation.
  • Revise documentation. As required, suggest and provide amendments to update and improve documentation.
  • Evaluate, create, update or convert airworthiness training objectives, training standards and training material for traditional classroom based training, elearning / on-line training, and blended learning. Deliver airworthiness training. Develop, prepare and deliver briefing materiel to DND/CAF and industry personnel.
  • Investigate specific activities including but not limited to: design of aeronautical products, proposed modifications, failure modes, actual incidents of failure, test data, etc. In their specific area of expertise when conducting technical investigations, whether individually or as part of a team, provide support to stakeholders to facilitate their performance of airworthiness and technical functions.
  • Develop, participate in, update and conduct research associated with risk assessment, mitigation and tracking; individually or as part of a team.

Qualifications:

  • Language(s): English
  • Security Clearance: Valid Secret (Level II)

1. Must have an undergraduate or a master’s degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in Aeronautical or Mechanical Engineering.

2. Must have specialist training and qualifications in aircraft systems for three (3) or more of the following systems:

a. Fuel;

b. Hydraulic;

c. Gear-Trains;

d. Engine Mounting;

e. Aircraft Interiors;

f. Undercarriage;

g. Secondary Power; or,

h. Air Management Systems.

3. Must have a minimum of ten (10) years of experience within the past fifteen (15) years, related to aircraft mechanical system engineering, with four (4) or more of the following aircraft mechanical systems:

a. Fuel systems including air to air refuelling, internal and external tanks, refuel etc.;

b. Secondary power systems and air management systems;

c. Helicopter main gearbox and transmission systems;

d. Mechanical systems (including engine mounting and support structure, oil systems, nacelles, ducting, etc.);

e. Hydraulic systems;

f. Landing gear including wheels, brakes, actuation etc.;

g. Aircraft interiors; or

h. Ground support systems (AMSE).

4. Must have a minimum of three (3) years of experience within the last seven (7) years in aircraft mechanical systems airworthiness certification including review of design specifications, work with a Basis of Certification, work with a certification plan, work with compliance programs and related compliance documentation.

Promaxis takes pride in valuing diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. Please notify any of our staff if you require any accommodations during the recruitment process. We would like to thank you for your interest in working for Promaxis; however, only those candidates that are under consideration will be contacted.

Promaxis is located in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $140,000.00-$164,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Gatineau, QC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Master's Degree (required)

Experience:

  • Aircraft Mechanical Engineering: 10 years (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Secret (Level II) Security Clearance (required)
