title: Intermediate Full Stack Software Engineer- Aviation
description:
For those who dream of advancing our space in the Universe and on Earth, we’ll take you there.

Serving the world from our Canadian home and our global offices, MDA is an international space mission partner and robotics & space operations, satellite systems and geointelligence pioneer with a 50-year story of firsts on and above the Earth. Today, we're leading the charge towards viable Moon colonies, enhanced Earth observation, communication in a hyper-connected world, and more.

We’re fueled by a pioneering spirit that carries us beyond. And together we enable highly skilled people to continually push boundaries and tackle big challenges requiring solutions that endure and inspire.

Are you ready to launch the next stage of your career in the new space economy? We would love to hear from you!

We’re on the hunt for an Intermediate Full Stack Software Engineer on our Geointelligence team at our Richmond office

Our mission is to turn data into insight. From detecting changes in fragile ecosystems to monitoring northern ice floes and shipping routes, our near-real time data of Earth observation and the environment makes our Geointelligence team a leader in geospatial imagery, ground stations, enterprise geospatial systems and defence programs.

As a Software Engineer with the Automated Charting and Encoding (ACE) program, you will make worldwide flight safer by improving the world’s most innovative and disruptive aeronautical charting system. You will successfully solve complex problems through hard work, a passion for quality, an inquisitive mind, a team-first approach and an innovative edge. A diverse team of domain experts and software professionals will support you.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Create engineering solutions to achieve the mission of our customers in a cost-effective way
  • Follow industry and corporate quality standards, and help establish new guidelines
  • Plan work, provide effort estimates, and drive your work to completion
  • Contribute to architecture / high level design
  • Design, code, test, integrate, deploy, debug and document high quality software
  • Review code, designs, and other technical artifacts
  • Provide technical mentoring for junior team members, including team training
  • Lead complex initiatives with diverse stakeholders
  • Troubleshoot problems in a fast-paced, continuous integration environment
  • Work from requirements to develop or modify complex software applications
  • Create internal tools to support team members and automated test
  • Identify innovative technological advances to support our long-term Aviation business goals

EXPERIENCE

  • A University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or other relevant discipline, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to solve complex problems within budget and on schedule
  • Programming experience with Perl, Python or Javascript
  • Experience with any of HTML, CSS, XML, SQL or SVG is also beneficial
  • Knowledge of object-oriented (OOP) design patterns
  • Previous experience in the Aviation domain and Aircraft navigation concepts and systems is not required—but a keen interest in learning about it is

We’re a dream team of purpose-driven, collaborative and passionate people, and we are constantly looking for others to join #TeamMDA to ignite new and innovative approaches to problem-solving that push us forward to improve life on and above Earth. If you’re excited to expand our place in space and driven to inspire the next generation, we’ll take you there.

We have entered a new era of exploration and development, and MDA welcomes all who yearn to suit up and be part of it. An equal opportunity employer prizing diversity, integrity and collaboration, we are committed to growing MDA’s and Canada’s leadership in this next golden age.

MDA provides competitive compensation and benefits packages for its employees at all locations. As a team member of MDA, you and your qualified dependents are eligible to participate in a benefit plan that ensures a comprehensive level of protection through competitive health care including; extended healthcare and flexible drug plans, dental and vision benefits, disability income protection, life insurance, group retirement savings plans; and an employee and family assistance program.

Comments/Special Considerations:

Successful candidates must obtain and hold security clearance at the reliability status level, and pass security assessment for the Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and ITAR.

MDA is an equal opportunity employer prizing diversity and inclusion. We are committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity. If you require assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please feel free to notify us.

title: A220 Structure Maintenance Program Analyst / Analyste mainte...
description:
Job Description:

**THE ENGLISH POSTING FOLLOWS**

Airbus est un pionnier international de l'industrie aérospatiale. Nous sommes un leader dans la conception, la fabrication et la livraison de produits, services et solutions aérospatiaux à des clients à l'échelle mondiale. Nous visons un monde mieux connecté, plus sûr et plus prospère.

Constructeur d'avions commerciaux, avec des divisions Espace et Défense ainsi que des Hélicoptères, Airbus est la plus grande entreprise aéronautique et spatiale en Europe et un leader mondial.

Chez Airbus Canada, nos collaborateurs travaillent ensemble à faire évoluer la mobilité partout dans le monde, une bonne idée après l'autre. Si vous avez une bonne idée, nous avons l'environnement pour qu'elle devienne un produit unique ou une expérience client exceptionnelle. Vos idées sont notre énergie.

PRINCIPAUX PROBLÈMES À RÉSOUDRE DANS LE POSTE :

Élaborer et mettre à jour le programme de maintenance planifiée de la structure conformément à la méthodologie MSG-3 et au processus du CEM
Soutenir, développer et optimiser les éléments de limitation de navigabilité tolérants aux dommages et la documentation AWL associée.
Gérer les analyses et les activités d'entretien du calendrier de la structure conformément à la planification et aux directives données par le coprésident du Groupe de travail sur l'entretien.
Gérer et fournir la contribution de maintenance planifiée pour respecter les exigences et les délais de certification.
Établir une relation de confiance avec les clients et les services d'ingénierie d'Airbus Canada et des autres sites d'Airbus.



PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS

Garantir l'établissement d'un programme d'entretien sécuritaire et économique conformément aux exigences de certification et au Manuel des politiques et procédures A220.
Être la voix de nos clients en ingénierie et améliorer la prise en compte des exigences du programme de maintenance.
Veiller au transfert de l'expérience client en service/des contraintes au bureau de conception.
Représente son domaine d'expertise, présente le programme de maintenance aux compagnies aériennes et aux autorités de navigabilité.
Représenter Airbus aux réunions des opérateurs, aux conférences techniques et aux séminaires internationaux de l'industrie.
Fournir une expertise en ingénierie de maintenance à d'autres divisions du Service Clientèle, ainsi qu'à d'autres directions d'Airbus (ventes, marketing, certification...)
Apporter une valeur ajoutée au programme d'entretien de l'A220 et prendre la tête d'initiatives et de projets.

PRINCIPAUX RÉSULTATS FINAUX

Contribuer à l'établissement d'un programme d'entretien sécuritaire et rentable
Contribuer aux principaux objectifs du Service à la clientèle d'Airbus Canada en ce qui concerne la cible financière et la réduction du CGD.



QUALIFICATIONS :

Ingénieur diplômé ayant de 5 à 7 ans d'expérience professionnelle, de préférence dans divers domaines d'activités tels que l'ingénierie des processus industriels, la gestion de programmes/projets, avec une expérience dans le domaine aéronautique, de préférence dans le soutien technique.
Bonne connaissance générale de la maintenance de la structure des aéronefs civils modernes
Connaissance de la tolérance à la fatigue et aux dommages
Bonnes compétences de présentation, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit.
Anglais courant, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit
Bonnes compétences de présentation.
Agile et organisé
Orientation client.
Très motivé par le soutien et le service à la clientèle.
Capacité de faire face à un environnement très exigeant.
Bonnes compétences de coordination et relationnelles pour interagir avec les clients, les centres de compétences de conception, les fournisseurs et les autres services d'Airbus.
Résolu, adaptable, ouvert d'esprit et flexible.
Esprit d'équipe fiable, clair, concis et complet lors du reporting.

Veuillez télécharger votre curriculum vitae en français et en anglais.

L'utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.

Airbus Canada souscrit au principe d'équité en matière d'emploi et encourage les femmes, les autochtones, les personnes handicapées et les membres des minorités visibles à soumettre leurs candidatures.

Airbus is an international pioneer in the aerospace industry. We are a leader in the design, manufacture and delivery of aerospace products, services and solutions to customers worldwide. We aim for a better connected, safer and more prosperous world.

Manufacturer of commercial aircraft, with Space and Defense divisions as well as Helicopters, Airbus is the largest aeronautics and Space Company in Europe and a world leader.

At Airbus Canada, our people work together to make mobility evolve around the world, one good idea after another. If you have a great idea, we have the environment for it to become a unique product or a great customer experience. Your ideas are our energy.

The jobholder will report to the A220 Maintenance Program Section Chief at Airbus Canada, Mirabel, CANADA.

BASIC PURPOSE

The jobholder will be primarily responsible for managing sections of the structure scheduled maintenance program within the framework of Airworthiness and Certification regulations. He/She will secure strong links with Structure Engineering Departments to adequately address Customers operations constraints and in-service experience linked to planned Maintenance. He/ She will drive innovations, improvement initiatives.

MAJOR PROBLEMS TO BE SOLVED IN THE POSITION

  • Develop and update the structure scheduled maintenance program according to MSG-3 methodology and MRB Process
  • Support, develop and optimize the Damage Tolerant Airworthiness Limitation Items and associated AWL documentation.
  • Manage the Structure schedule maintenance analyses and activities according to the planning and directives given by the Maintenance Working Group Co-Chair.
  • Manage and deliver planned maintenance contribution to meet Certification requirements and deadlines.
  • Develop a relationship of trust with Customers and the Engineering departments in Airbus Canada and the other Airbus sites.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Guaranty the establishment of a safe and economical maintenance program according to certification requirements and the A220 Policy and Procedures Handbook.
  • Be the voice of our Customers in Engineering and enhance maintenance program requirements consideration.
  • Ensure transfer of Customer in-service experience/constraints to the design office.
  • Represents his/ her domain of expertise, presents Maintenance program to Airlines and Airworthiness Authorities.
  • Represent Airbus in Operator meetings, technical conferences and international industry seminars.
  • Provide maintenance engineering support expertise to other Customer Services divisions, as well as to other Airbus directorates (sales, marketing, certification...)
  • Bring added value to the A220 Maintenance Program and take the lead of initiatives and projects.

MAJOR END RESULTS

  • Contribute to the establishment of a safe and cost efficient maintenance program
  • Contribute to Airbus Canada Customer Services top objectives with regards to financial target and DMC reduction.

Qualifications:

  • Knowledgeable graduated engineer with 5 to 7 years of professional experience preferably in various areas of activities such as industrial process engineering, Program / Project management, with experience in aeronautical field preferably in engineering support.
  • Good general knowledge in the maintenance of aircraft structure for modern civil aircraft
  • Knowledge in Fatigue & Damage Tolerance
  • Good presentation skills, both oral and written.
  • Fluent in English, both oral and written
  • Good presentation skills.
  • Agile and organized
  • Customer centricity oriented.
  • Highly motivated by Customer support and service minded.
  • Ability to cope with highly demanding environment.
  • Good co-ordination and relational skills to engage with Customers, Design Centres of Competency, Suppliers and other Airbus departments.
  • Resolute, adaptable, open-minded and flexible.
  • Reliable Team player, clear, concise and comprehensive when reporting.

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company:

Airbus Canada Limited Partnership

Contract Type:

Experience Level:

Job Family:

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.
Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com .

title: AIRBUS CANADA - Pilote d'essai de production / Production Te...
description:
Job Description:

**THE ENGLISH POSTING FOLLOWS**

Airbus est un pionnier international de l'industrie aérospatiale. Nous sommes un leader dans la conception, la fabrication et la livraison de produits, services et solutions aérospatiaux à des clients à l'échelle mondiale. Nous visons un monde mieux connecté, plus sûr et plus prospère.

Constructeur d'avions commerciaux, avec des divisions Espace et Défense ainsi que des hélicoptères, Airbus est la plus grande entreprise aéronautique et spatiale en Europe et un leader mondial.

Chez Airbus Canada, nos collaborateurs travaillent ensemble à faire évoluer la mobilité partout dans le monde, une bonne idée après l'autre. Si vous avez une bonne idée, nous avons l'environnement pour qu'elle devienne un produit unique ou une expérience client exceptionnelle. Vos idées sont notre énergie.

Dans vos fonctions, vous serez appelé à :

  • Responsable de la conduite de l'ensemble du vol en assumant la sécurité du vol.

  • Rédiger et/ou réviser les plans et rapports de test de développement ou de certification pour les tests en vol assignés.

  • Participer aux réunions de préparation aux tests.

  • Participer à la planification, à la coordination et à la programmation à court terme des tests à effectuer sur les avions d'essai assignés.

  • Coordonner, sur demande, avec les ingénieurs d'essais en vol en s'assurant que l'aéronef est correctement configuré pour atteindre les objectifs des essais.

  • Planifier et mener des activités de développement, de certification, de production, de marketing et de vente et d'essais en vol de formation sur les aéronefs assignés.

  • Préparer et distribuer les rapports de vol après chaque vol d'essai assigné.

  • Identifier et signaler les problèmes des clients et de certification à la direction du programme.

  • Soutenir les essais en vol de production et les activités de vol d'entreprise au besoin.

  • Agir en tant que client interne en tant qu'organisme indépendant pour vérifier initialement le produit final.

  • Soutien à la conception dès les premières étapes du programme.

  • Apporter une contribution opérationnelle et une compréhension à tous les niveaux.

  • Soutenir les campagnes de marketing et de vente.

  • Soutenir d'autres organisations dans les relations avec les clients.

  • Services d'assistance dans le domaine de l'assistance à la clientèle, de la documentation des aéronefs et de la formation.

  • Communication efficace des observations des essais en vol aux ingénieurs et à la communauté des pilotes, créant ainsi un fossé entre ceux qui conçoivent et construisent des aéronefs et ceux qui utilisent l'aéronef pour la mission prévue.

  • Piloter et évaluer des aéronefs expérimentaux, nouvellement produits et modifiés avec des manœuvres spécifiques (techniques d'essais en vol).

  • Contribution au progrès aéronautique en promouvant une conception et un développement aéronautiques solides.

En tant que candidat idéal,

  • Doit être diplômé d'une école de pilotage d'essai reconnue ou l'équivalente

  • Doit détenir un ATPL OACI, EASA avec Flight test rating est un plus.

  • Avoir une expérience de 5 ans dans les essais d’avions de transport aérien (CS-25)

  • Une expérience opérationnelle dans l’environnement d’une compagnie aérienne.

Veuillez télécharger votre curriculum vitae en français et en anglais.

L'utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.

Airbus Canada souscrit au principe d'équité en matière d'emploi et encourage les femmes, les autochtones, les personnes handicapées et les membres des minorités visibles à soumettre leurs candidatures.

******************************************************************************************************

Airbus is an international pioneer in the aerospace industry. We are a leader in the design, manufacture and delivery of aerospace products, services and solutions to customers worldwide. We aim for a better connected, safer and more prosperous world.

Manufacturer of commercial aircraft, with Space and Defense divisions as well as Helicopters, Airbus is the largest aeronautics and Space Company in Europe and a world leader.

At Airbus Canada, our people work together to make mobility evolve around the world, one good idea after another. If you have a great idea, we have the environment for it to become a unique product or a great customer experience. Your ideas are our energy.

In your duties, you will be called upon to:

  • Responsible for the conduct of the whole flight assuming flight safety.

  • Write and/or review development or certification test plans and reports for assigned flight tests.

  • Participate in test readiness meetings.

  • Participate in the planning, coordination, and short-term scheduling of tests to be performed on assigned test aircraft.

  • Coordinate with flight test engineers as required ensuring the aircraft is configured properly to meet test objectives.

  • Plan and conduct development, certification, production, marketing & sales and training flight test activities on assigned aircraft.

  • Prepare and distribute Flight Reports after each assigned test flight.

  • Identify and report customer and certification issues to Program Management.

  • Support production flight test and corporate flight activities on as-needed basis.

  • Act as internal customer as an independent body to initially verify the final product.

  • Support to Design from early stages of the Program.

  • Provide Operational inputs and understanding at all levels.

  • Support marketing and sales campaigns.

  • Support other organizations with the relations with customers.

  • Support Services in Customer support, aircraft documentation and Training.

  • Effective communication of flight test observations to engineers and pilot community, thus bringing the gap between those who design and build aircraft with those who employ the aircraft for the intended mission .

  • Fly and evaluate experimental, newly produced and modified aircraft with specific manoeuvres (flight test techniques).

  • Contribution to aeronautical advancement by promoting sound aeronautical design and development.

As the ideal candidate,

  • Must be graduated from a recognized test pilot school or equivalent.

  • Must hold an ICAO ATPL, EASA with Flight test rating is a plus

  • 5 years previous experience in flight testing of transport category aircrafts (CS-25)

  • Operational experience in the airline environment

The use of the masculine gender has been adopted for ease of reading and has no discriminatory intent.

Airbus Canada subscribes to the principle of employment equity and encourages women, aboriginals, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply.

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company:

Airbus Canada Limited Partnership

Contract Type:

Permanent Contract / CDI / Unbefristet / Contrato indefinido

Experience Level:

Professional / Expérimenté(e) / Professionell / Profesional

Job Family:

Testing <JF-EN-ET>

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.
Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com .

title: Design Release Engineer - Power Mirrors
description:
Transforming the Future with Convergence of Simulation and Data

Design Release Engineer - Intermediate

Job Summary:

Our client in Windsor, Ontario is looking for an Design Release Engineer. This is a contract position.

What You Will Do:

  • The Design Release Engineer is responsible for the engineering, design, development, validation, timing and production release of exterior rearview mirrors.

  • The Engineer will have end to end ownership of their components and ensuring they meet vehicle functional objectives.

  • Responsibilities also include: component design, development, and packaging; collaboration with PDO and Sciences, Design Verification Plan & Report (DVPR) testing; change management; bill of material maintenance; prototype and production build support; issues management; weight reduction, cost reduction and other efficiency improvement initiatives; and communicating technical product status to management.

  • Additionally, supporting vehicle assembly plants for any product technical issues, support service teams for any field warranty issues and help in root cause analysis of the failures.

Basics:

  • A minimum of 3 years of design/release experience in automotive components

  • A minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Aerospace/Aeronautical or Electrical Engineering (or equivalent) from an ABET accredited university

  • Excellent program management, communication skills

  • Proficient in Excel, Word, PowerPoint

How You Will Be Successful:

  • Envision the Future
  • Communicate Honestly and Broadly
  • Seek Technology and Business “First”
  • Embrace Diversity and Take Risks

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Comprehensive Benefit Package
  • 401(k) with matching contributions
  • Paid Time Off
  • Employee Discounts
  • Free training on all Altair products

Why Work with Us:

Altair is a global technology company providing software and cloud solutions in the areas of data analytics, product development, and high-performance computing (HPC). Altair enables organizations in nearly every industry to compete more effectively in a connected world, while creating a more sustainable future. With more than 3,000 engineers, scientists, and creative thinkers in 25 countries, we help solve our customer’s toughest challenges and deliver unparalleled service, helping the innovators innovate, drive better decisions, and turn today’s problems into tomorrow’s opportunities.

Our vision is to transform customer decision making with data analytics, simulation, and high-performance computing.

For more than 30 years, we have been helping our customers integrate electronics and controls with mechanical design to expand product value, develop AI, simulation and data-driven digital twins to drive better decisions, and deliver advanced HPC and cloud solutions to support unlimited idea exploration. To learn more, please visit altair.com

Ready to go? #ONLYFORWARD

At our core we are explorers; adventures; pioneers. We are the brains behind some of the world’s most revolutionary innovations and are not only comfortable in new and unchartered waters, we dive headfirst. We are the original trailblazers that make the impossible possible, discovering new solutions to our customer’s toughest challenges.

Altair is an equal opportunity employer. Our backgrounds are diverse, and every member of our global team is critical to our success. Altair’s history demonstrations a belief that empowering each individual authentic voice reinforces a culture that thrives because of the uniqueness among our team.

title: Software Integration and Test Lead
description:
About MDA

For those who dream of advancing our space in the Universe and on Earth, we’ll take you there. Serving the world from our Canadian home and our global offices, MDA is an international space mission partner and robotics & space operations, satellite systems and geointelligence pioneer with a 50-year story of firsts on and above the Earth. Today, we're leading the charge towards viable Moon colonies, enhanced Earth observation, communication in a hyper-connected world, and more.

Are you ready to launch the next stage of your career in the new space economy? We would love to hear from you!

The Role

We are looking for an Intermediate to Senior engineer who would initially participate within the team as a hands-on development team member working and learning the software, and/or firmware, custom HW integration, with the intent of growing into the role of Software Integration and Test Lead.

As a member of the Engineering team you will work on our programs such as Chorus Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) Satellite, Canadian Surface Combatant (CSC), Square Kilometer Array (SKA) radio telescope, Aeronautical Navigation products, and Marine Insights products. You will work as part of a technical team to develop new capabilities, enhance existing capabilities and deliver solutions to our customers.

Responsibilities:

As a development engineer initially and eventually the Software Integration and Test Lead, you will have the opportunity to establish ownership and demonstrate your abilities, including:

  • Working with radio astronomy scientists and system engineers to develop an understanding and ownership of the algorithms we wish to implement.
  • Working with an internationally distributed team to refine subsystem requirements, develop the software design and implement the software/firmware.
  • Design and implement the subsystem control software using the Tango Control System, and applications written in Python and C++. The application software components are embedded in Docker containers that are orchestrated using Kubernetes and Helm charts.
  • Design and implement algorithms that run using Tango Control System device servers to run on ARM processors embedded in Intel SoC FGPAs.
  • Design and implement software for control and monitoring of the FPGA processing (using the TANGO Control System).
  • Participate with the test data generation team to create test datasets for algorithm and model validation.
  • Lead the integration team to integrate and test the subsystems into each release.
  • Create, review and maintain technical documentation, such as design specifications, design implementations and test results.
  • Technical planning, monitoring and control, risk management, change management, estimation, scheduling, team mentoring, system engineering.
  • Work within the SAFe development framework and demonstrate lean-agile leadership characteristics.
  • Be willing to travel to Penticton B.C. and South Africa to participate in assembly, installation, integration, verification events, as required.

General requirements:

  • A university degree in engineering, computer science or other relevant discipline, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Experience being a technical lead and integration of a complex, computer-based project or component.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability and motivation to learn new things.
  • Excellent team player
  • Bachelors degree or more in related field (engineering, computer science, math, physics).
  • Minimum of 3 years in the last 5 working on signal processing software development.
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a combination of one or more of the following areas in the last 10 years:
  • Software/firmware intensive complex systems
  • Technical oversight of software component of system or sub-system
  • System engineering of complex computer-based systems
  • Experience leading engineering teams
  • Working with digital signal processing systems
  • Experience with the full engineering lifecycle for complex systems
  • The following is desirable (some combination of):
  • Experience with C/C++ and Python
  • Experience with MATLAB.
  • Experience with firmware for System on Chip (SoC) FPGA devices.
  • Experience with software development for embedded processors.
  • Experience with VHDL.
  • Experience with Intel FPGA development tools.
  • Experience with signal processing instrumentation for radio astronomy.
  • Experience with Agile/SAFe development methodology.
  • Experience with software development on custom or specialized hardware.
  • Experience with software development for signal processing.

Additional qualifications:

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a combination of one or more of the following areas:
  • Leading engineering teams
  • Complex signal processing software/firmware intensive systems
  • Technical oversight of system software and hardware assembly, integration and test
  • Working with digital signal processing systems
  • Systems architected to use Kubernetes and Dockers
  • Automated testing
  • CI/CD pipelines
  • CMake and Make software building tools
  • MATLAB programming, system modeling and data analysis
  • Developing software for embedded real-time targets
  • Developing software on Linux distributions such Ubuntu using Docker
  • Software development on custom or specialized hardware using embedded processors
  • Nexus C++ and Python library, Docker image and firmware repository management
  • GitLab CI/CD pipelines to build x86 and ARM executables and perform unit testing
  • Intel and Xilinx FPGA development processes and tools
  • Firmware for System on Chip (SoC) FPGA devices
  • Tango Control System or similar distributed control software
  • Software development for signal processing, instrumentation for radio astronomy
  • High availability control system design utilizing Kubernetes and Dockers
  • Integrating geographically-distributed systems
  • DevOps

Comments/Special Considerations:

Successful candidates must obtain and hold security clearance at the reliability status level, and pass security assessment for the Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and ITAR.

MDA provides competitive compensation and benefits packages for its employees at all locations. As a team member of MDA, you and your qualified dependents are eligible to participate in a benefit plan that ensures a comprehensive level of protection through competitive health care including; extended healthcare and flexible drug plans, dental and vision benefits, disability income protection, life insurance, group retirement savings plans; and an employee and family assistance program.

MDA is an equal opportunity employer prizing diversity and inclusion. We are committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity. If you require assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please feel free to notify us.

With a priority on maintaining the safety of our employees, customers and communities, MDA has implemented a mandatory vaccination policy for employees and visitors. Please speak to a recruiter for more details.

title: Sr Engineer- Software Development
description:
For those who dream of advancing our space in the Universe and on Earth, we’ll take you there.

Serving the world from our Canadian home and our global offices, MDA is an international space mission partner and robotics & space operations, satellite systems and geointelligence pioneer with a 50-year story of firsts on and above the Earth. Today, we're leading the charge towards viable Moon colonies, enhanced Earth observation, communication in a hyper-connected world, and more.

We’re fueled by a pioneering spirit that carries us beyond. And together we enable highly skilled people to continually push boundaries and tackle big challenges requiring solutions that endure and inspire.

Are you ready to launch the next stage of your career in the new space economy? We would love to hear from you!

We’re on the hunt for a Senior Software Engineer in our Geointelligence Engineering Team at our Richmond office.

Our mission is to turn data into insight. From detecting changes in fragile ecosystems to monitoring northern ice floes and shipping routes, our near-real time data of Earth observation and the environment makes our Geointelligence team a leader in geospatial imagery, ground stations, enterprise geospatial systems and defence programs.

As a member of the Engineering team you will work on our programs such as Chorus Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) Satellite, Canadian Surface Combatant (CSC), Square Kilometer Array (SKA) radio telescope, Aeronautical Navigation products, and Marine Insights products. You will work as part of a technical team to develop new capabilities, enhance existing capabilities and deliver solutions to our customers.

As part of your growth and development we will work with you to establish your development actions alongside regular progress reviews. You are likely to move through various projects to gain the experience and knowledge to progress your career with us.


Role:

  • Lead a small team of software engineers to design and implement software components for the CHORUS Ground Segment Monitoring, Reporting and Support Subsystem (MARS)
  • Plan work, provide effort estimates, and drive work to completion – on time & on budget
  • Create engineering solutions that are technically competitive, cost-effective and have a direct impact on our customers
  • Work from requirements to develop or modify complex hardware/software systems
  • Design, code, test, debug and document high-quality software components
  • Participate in integration, testing and deployment of applications
  • Assist in troubleshooting problems in the production environments
  • Identify and incorporate new technology in line with long-term goals
  • Follow established development process and corporate technical quality standards
  • Contribute to the continual improvement of our development processes

Requirements/Skills:

  • A University Degree in computer science, software engineering, or a combination of related education and experience.
  • Proficient in at least one of Golang, Java, or C++.
  • Experience with Docker and service orchestration frameworks like Kubernetes and Rancher
  • Experience with microservice architectures and RESTful APIs
  • An understanding of modern software architectures, object oriented design, and software design patterns.
  • Ability to quickly learn on the job and leverage your experiences and knowledge.
  • Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication.
  • Team oriented approach.

Desirable:

  • Experience with Agile software development
  • Experience with test automation tools and libraries

We’re a dream team of purpose-driven, collaborative and passionate people, and we are constantly looking for others to join #TeamMDA to ignite new and innovative approaches to problem-solving that push us forward to improve life on and above Earth. If you’re excited to expand our place in space and driven to inspire the next generation, we’ll take you there.

We have entered a new era of exploration and development, and MDA welcomes all who yearn to suit up and be part of it. An equal opportunity employer prizing diversity, integrity and collaboration, we are committed to growing MDA’s and Canada’s leadership in this next golden age.

Comments/Special Considerations:

Successful candidates must obtain and hold security clearance at the reliability status level, and pass security assessment for the Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and ITAR.

MDA provides competitive compensation and benefits packages for its employees at all locations. As a team member of MDA, you and your qualified dependents are eligible to participate in a benefit plan that ensures a comprehensive level of protection through competitive health care including; extended healthcare and flexible drug plans, dental and vision benefits, disability income protection, life insurance, group retirement savings plans; and an employee and family assistance program.

MDA is an equal opportunity employer prizing diversity and inclusion. We are committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity. If you require assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please feel free to notify us.

With a priority on maintaining the safety of our employees, customers and communities, MDA has implemented a mandatory vaccination policy for employees and visitors. Please speak to a recruiter for more details.

title: Spécialiste de Compte / Account Specialist
description:
#Nousembauchons #chaîned'approvisionnement #SpécialistedeCompte #procurement

Titre de poste: Spécialiste en approvisionnement
Contrat: 12 mois renouvable
Location: Longueil, QC
Code regional: 514,438,450
Code postale: J4G 1A1
Date de debut: plutot possible
Shift: Shift de Jour (40h)
Mots clés: #chaîned'approvisionnement #SpécialistedeCompte #procurement

Le Spécialiste en approvissionment sera responsable de l"achat de matériel et de ressources pour l'entreprise

Responsabilité:
  • Responsable de la performance du point de vue de la qualité, des coûts de livraison, ainsi que des initiatives d'amélioration continue
  • Responsable de projets entiers avec une portée et une complexité significatives
  • Contribue au département ou à l'unité commerciale en appliquant ses connaissances avancées d'un ou de plusieurs domaines fonctionnels
  • Responsabilités spécifiques du poste
  • Gère les comptes fournisseurs
  • Développe et dirige la stratégie commerciale et l'administration des contrats avec les fournisseurs
  • Dirige les négociations avec les fournisseurs
  • Coordonner et soutenir les propositions des fournisseurs pour la sélection de nouveaux programmes
  • assure la supervision et le leadership en ce qui concerne les performances des fournisseurs, telles que les livraisons, la qualité, la gestion des coûts et l'amélioration continue
  • Développe un aperçu stratégique de la capacité des fournisseurs et participe activement au sourçage stratégique qui aligne la vision des fournisseurs et de la société
  • Gère tous les aspects de la chaîne d'approvisionnement, y compris la logistique de production et de pièces de rechange
Experience:
  • Possèder des connaissances spécialisées couvrant plusieurs disciplines
  • Assurer la gestion du contrat lié aux fournisseurs désignés
  • Diriger les négociations avec les fournisseurs assignés dans le cadre de la vision stratégique
  • Fournir le soutien nécessaire à la préparation de forums liés à la chaîne d'approvisionnement
  • Responsable des achats liés à l"introduction de nouvelles pièces pour une famille de pièces donnée
******
#WeAreHiring #AccountSpecialist #procurement #SupplyChain

Job Title: Account Specialist
Contract: 12 months renewable
Location: Longueil, QC
Area Code: 514,438,450
Postal Code: J4G 1A1
Start Date: ASAP
Shift: Day shift (40h)
Keywords: #AccountSpecialist #Aeronautical # Aerospace #procurement #logistics #SupplyChain

The Account Specialist will purchase the materials and resources for the company

Experience:
  • Responsible for the performance of a quality standpoint, delivery costs, as well as continuous improvement initiatives
  • Ensures the management of the contract connected with the designated suppliers
  • Provides support required for the preparation of forums related to the supply chain
  • Responsible for procurement items associated with the introduction of new parts for a given part family
Role:
  • Responsible for entire projects with significant scope and complexity
  • Contributes to the department or business unit by applying their advanced knowledge of one or more functional areas
  • Has expert knowledge that extends across multiple disciplines
  • Manages Supplier Accounts
  • Develops and drives commercial strategy and contract administration with suppliers
  • Leads suppliers negotiations
  • Coordinate and support supplier proposals for new program selection
  • Provides oversight and leadership with regards to supplier performance such as deliveries, quality, cost management, and continuous improvement
  • Develops a strategic outlook of supplier capability and actively participates in strategic sourcing which aligns suppliers' and company's vision
  • Manages all aspects of supply chain including production and aftermarket logistics
Belcan is a global supplier of engineering, technical recruiting, and IT services to customers in the aerospace, industrial, and government sectors. Belcan engineers" better outcomes through adaptive and integrated services-from jet engines, airframe, and avionics to heavy vehicles, chemical processing, and cybersecurity. Belcan takes a partnering approach to provide customer-driven solutions that are flexible, scalable, and cost-effective. Our unique capabilities have led to continuous growth and success for nearly 60 years. We are a team-driven Equal Opportunity Employer committed to workforce diversity

title: Flight Controls Engineer
description:
About Us,

Capgemini Engineering consolidates a unique set of market leading capabilities in engineering and R&D. Along with the Group’s deep industry expertise and cutting-edge technologies in digital and software, it will support organizations as the digital and physical worlds converge. The global business line [1], with its 52,000 engineers and scientists and a presence in all major engineering hubs across the world, builds on the integration of Altran, one year on from its acquisition by Capgemini.


Flight controls Engineer

Location: Montreal/Mirabel, QC, Canada



Key Job responsibilities:

In this role you will

· Work on developing the Functional Specification of Flight Controls

· Develop algorithms for Aircraft Piloting Laws and functionalities of Flight Control systems

· Evaluate handling Qualities of the aircraft

· Perform Failure case analysis

· Perform non-regression testing, verification and validation of flight control laws


Basic Qualifications:

· Bachelor or Master's degree in Aerospace Engineering

· 5-10 years of experience in Primary and secondary Flight Controls design and development

· More than 5 years of relevant experience with experience on aircraft development program(s)

· Good knowledge with the specification, design, integration, test and certification of Flight control systems and/or its components

· Strong knowledge in flight mechanics and handling qualities of the aircraft

· Good knowledge of RTCA documents DO-160 and DO-178

· Familiar with part FAR25 / 525 certification process and with the ARP4754 standard

· Experience in simulation with MATLAB software is an asset

· Ability to make robust and accurate decisions, exercising good judgment skills

· Ability to multitask and to be flexible to change tasks with little or no notice

· Team player with strong communication (verbal and written)

· Organized, able to manage your time and be able to prioritize tasks effectively with short

deadlines


Preferred Qualifications:

· Knowledge of aerodynamics of aircraft and aircraft loads

· Working experience with Simulink

· Programming skills with Python or other coding languages

· Must have an innovative mindset, be proactive in improving processes and driving projects

· Excellent communicator, team player, resourceful, organized and mindful of time management

· Being a self-starter, working well with little oversight independently or as a part of a team

· Ability to quickly adapt to evolving and growing business needs


EEO

Capgemini Engineering provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Specialist, Mechanical Engineer (Thermal Hydraulics Design)
description:
The Mechanical Design Engineer, under the direction of the Mechanical Engineering Manager, is primarily responsible for design and development of their responsible mechanical systems through the Basic Engineering phase. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a truly innovative advanced reactor design, the IMSR. Other responsibilities include:
  • Develop passive and active thermal management and heat transfer design solutions in accordance with applicable design guides, procedures, and codes & standards
  • Provide expertise in selection, design and performance of pumps, valves, heat exchangers, tanks and vessels, including overpressure protection
  • Prepare calculations (thermodynamics, heat transfer, fluid dynamics, heat mass balance, equipment sizing, etc.), analyses and assessment documents for the development of complex mechanical and fluid systems and components
  • Design piping systems including line sizing and pressure drop calculations
  • Prepare design plans, system classifications, design requirements and other design documentation in accordance with applicable design guides, procedures, and codes & standards
  • Incorporate methodologies to facilitate constructability, commissioning, operability, maintainability, inspectability, testability and decommissioning
  • Collaborate with the Thermal Hydraulics Team for execution of detailed thermal hydraulics modelling and CFD simulations
  • Prepare and/or review Design Change Packages
  • Contribute to the material selection and qualification processes as part of the Terrestrial Energy Research & Development (R&D) program
  • Identify needed R&D work and any associated testing or other validation and verification activities. Prepare or support the preparation of test plans
  • Coordinate and interface with the plant layout lead in the development of 3D CAD models and 2D engineering drawings for the responsible mechanical systems
  • Coordinate with other interfacing disciplines such as Electrical, I&C, Civil, etc...
  • Oversee and collaborate with external vendors, and carry-out vendor deliverable reviews
  • Contribute to timely resolution of mechanical design challenges and address risks
  • Conduct presentations to interdisciplinary teams and external parties
  • Provide technical guidance and leadership to other engineers or EITs

Core Competencies
  • Communication
  • Critical Thinking
  • Decision Making
  • Leadership
  • Problem Solving
  • Results Orientation
  • Teamwork & Collaboration
  • Flexible and Adaptable

Requirements
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in Mechanical Engineering, or alternate degree in a related field
  • Registered Professional Engineering in Ontario
  • Minimum 8 years of work experience in the design of mechanical, fluid, and heat transfer systems and components, preferably in the nuclear industry
  • Strong mechanical aptitude. Track record of innovative contributions to design and demonstrated success in project delivery. Experienced in preparation of design documentation (e.g. design plans, system classifications, design requirements, flow diagrams, design change packages etc)
  • Experience in selection, design and performance of pumps, valves, heat exchangers, tanks and vessels, including overpressure protection
  • Strong knowledge in power plant systems, thermodynamics, fluid dynamics, heat transfer, heat and mass balance, overpressure protection, and mechanics of materials
  • Expert ability to design systems and components to achieve desired Thermal Hydraulic requirements, and experience in preparing supporting calculations (thermodynamics, heat transfer, fluid dynamics, heat mass balance, equipment sizing, etc.)
  • Experience in preparation of test plans is an asset
  • Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills
  • Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines
  • Strong communication (both written and verbal) skills
  • Skilled at developing and maintaining strong relationships across all levels of the organization and with external customers and vendors

Assets
  • Industry experience in the Nuclear Power, Small Modular Reactors, and/or Solar Plants (molten salt)
  • Expert or working knowledge of nuclear pressure boundary codes including ASME Section III Division 1 and Division 5, CSA N285.0
  • Working knowledge of ANSYS Mechanical, Creo Parametric, or other 3D modelling and FEA software

Benefits
  • Extended Healthcare Plan (Medical, Disability, Dental & Vision)
  • Paid Time Off Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program - Counseling
  • Hybrid/Flexible Work Arrangements Available
  • Wellness Reimbursement Subsidy Program

We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Terrestrial Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected status.

If you require accommodation during the application or interview process, please advise us as soon as possible so appropriate arrangements can be made. If you require technical support in a format that is accessible to you, please contact Human Resources at AODA@terrestrialenergy.com.

title: AIRBUS CANADA - Ingénieur concepteur de réparation (quart de jour) / Repair Designer Engineer (day shift)
description:
The Mechanical Design Engineer, under the direction of the Mechanical Engineering Manager, is primarily responsible for design and development of their responsible mechanical systems through the Basic Engineering phase. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a truly innovative advanced reactor design, the IMSR. Other responsibilities include:
  • Develop passive and active thermal management and heat transfer design solutions in accordance with applicable design guides, procedures, and codes & standards
  • Provide expertise in selection, design and performance of pumps, valves, heat exchangers, tanks and vessels, including overpressure protection
  • Prepare calculations (thermodynamics, heat transfer, fluid dynamics, heat mass balance, equipment sizing, etc.), analyses and assessment documents for the development of complex mechanical and fluid systems and components
  • Design piping systems including line sizing and pressure drop calculations
  • Prepare design plans, system classifications, design requirements and other design documentation in accordance with applicable design guides, procedures, and codes & standards
  • Incorporate methodologies to facilitate constructability, commissioning, operability, maintainability, inspectability, testability and decommissioning
  • Collaborate with the Thermal Hydraulics Team for execution of detailed thermal hydraulics modelling and CFD simulations
  • Prepare and/or review Design Change Packages
  • Contribute to the material selection and qualification processes as part of the Terrestrial Energy Research & Development (R&D) program
  • Identify needed R&D work and any associated testing or other validation and verification activities. Prepare or support the preparation of test plans
  • Coordinate and interface with the plant layout lead in the development of 3D CAD models and 2D engineering drawings for the responsible mechanical systems
  • Coordinate with other interfacing disciplines such as Electrical, I&C, Civil, etc...
  • Oversee and collaborate with external vendors, and carry-out vendor deliverable reviews
  • Contribute to timely resolution of mechanical design challenges and address risks
  • Conduct presentations to interdisciplinary teams and external parties
  • Provide technical guidance and leadership to other engineers or EITs

Core Competencies
  • Communication
  • Critical Thinking
  • Decision Making
  • Leadership
  • Problem Solving
  • Results Orientation
  • Teamwork & Collaboration
  • Flexible and Adaptable

Requirements
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in Mechanical Engineering, or alternate degree in a related field
  • Registered Professional Engineering in Ontario
  • Minimum 8 years of work experience in the design of mechanical, fluid, and heat transfer systems and components, preferably in the nuclear industry
  • Strong mechanical aptitude. Track record of innovative contributions to design and demonstrated success in project delivery. Experienced in preparation of design documentation (e.g. design plans, system classifications, design requirements, flow diagrams, design change packages etc)
  • Experience in selection, design and performance of pumps, valves, heat exchangers, tanks and vessels, including overpressure protection
  • Strong knowledge in power plant systems, thermodynamics, fluid dynamics, heat transfer, heat and mass balance, overpressure protection, and mechanics of materials
  • Expert ability to design systems and components to achieve desired Thermal Hydraulic requirements, and experience in preparing supporting calculations (thermodynamics, heat transfer, fluid dynamics, heat mass balance, equipment sizing, etc.)
  • Experience in preparation of test plans is an asset
  • Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills
  • Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines
  • Strong communication (both written and verbal) skills
  • Skilled at developing and maintaining strong relationships across all levels of the organization and with external customers and vendors

Assets
  • Industry experience in the Nuclear Power, Small Modular Reactors, and/or Solar Plants (molten salt)
  • Expert or working knowledge of nuclear pressure boundary codes including ASME Section III Division 1 and Division 5, CSA N285.0
  • Working knowledge of ANSYS Mechanical, Creo Parametric, or other 3D modelling and FEA software

Benefits
  • Extended Healthcare Plan (Medical, Disability, Dental & Vision)
  • Paid Time Off Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program - Counseling
  • Hybrid/Flexible Work Arrangements Available
  • Wellness Reimbursement Subsidy Program

We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Terrestrial Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected status.

If you require accommodation during the application or interview process, please advise us as soon as possible so appropriate arrangements can be made. If you require technical support in a format that is accessible to you, please contact Human Resources at AODA@terrestrialenergy.com.

title: Electronical Engineer (Aerospace) C++
description:
The Mechanical Design Engineer, under the direction of the Mechanical Engineering Manager, is primarily responsible for design and development of their responsible mechanical systems through the Basic Engineering phase. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a truly innovative advanced reactor design, the IMSR. Other responsibilities include:
  • Develop passive and active thermal management and heat transfer design solutions in accordance with applicable design guides, procedures, and codes & standards
  • Provide expertise in selection, design and performance of pumps, valves, heat exchangers, tanks and vessels, including overpressure protection
  • Prepare calculations (thermodynamics, heat transfer, fluid dynamics, heat mass balance, equipment sizing, etc.), analyses and assessment documents for the development of complex mechanical and fluid systems and components
  • Design piping systems including line sizing and pressure drop calculations
  • Prepare design plans, system classifications, design requirements and other design documentation in accordance with applicable design guides, procedures, and codes & standards
  • Incorporate methodologies to facilitate constructability, commissioning, operability, maintainability, inspectability, testability and decommissioning
  • Collaborate with the Thermal Hydraulics Team for execution of detailed thermal hydraulics modelling and CFD simulations
  • Prepare and/or review Design Change Packages
  • Contribute to the material selection and qualification processes as part of the Terrestrial Energy Research & Development (R&D) program
  • Identify needed R&D work and any associated testing or other validation and verification activities. Prepare or support the preparation of test plans
  • Coordinate and interface with the plant layout lead in the development of 3D CAD models and 2D engineering drawings for the responsible mechanical systems
  • Coordinate with other interfacing disciplines such as Electrical, I&C, Civil, etc...
  • Oversee and collaborate with external vendors, and carry-out vendor deliverable reviews
  • Contribute to timely resolution of mechanical design challenges and address risks
  • Conduct presentations to interdisciplinary teams and external parties
  • Provide technical guidance and leadership to other engineers or EITs

Core Competencies
  • Communication
  • Critical Thinking
  • Decision Making
  • Leadership
  • Problem Solving
  • Results Orientation
  • Teamwork & Collaboration
  • Flexible and Adaptable

Requirements
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in Mechanical Engineering, or alternate degree in a related field
  • Registered Professional Engineering in Ontario
  • Minimum 8 years of work experience in the design of mechanical, fluid, and heat transfer systems and components, preferably in the nuclear industry
  • Strong mechanical aptitude. Track record of innovative contributions to design and demonstrated success in project delivery. Experienced in preparation of design documentation (e.g. design plans, system classifications, design requirements, flow diagrams, design change packages etc)
  • Experience in selection, design and performance of pumps, valves, heat exchangers, tanks and vessels, including overpressure protection
  • Strong knowledge in power plant systems, thermodynamics, fluid dynamics, heat transfer, heat and mass balance, overpressure protection, and mechanics of materials
  • Expert ability to design systems and components to achieve desired Thermal Hydraulic requirements, and experience in preparing supporting calculations (thermodynamics, heat transfer, fluid dynamics, heat mass balance, equipment sizing, etc.)
  • Experience in preparation of test plans is an asset
  • Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills
  • Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines
  • Strong communication (both written and verbal) skills
  • Skilled at developing and maintaining strong relationships across all levels of the organization and with external customers and vendors

Assets
  • Industry experience in the Nuclear Power, Small Modular Reactors, and/or Solar Plants (molten salt)
  • Expert or working knowledge of nuclear pressure boundary codes including ASME Section III Division 1 and Division 5, CSA N285.0
  • Working knowledge of ANSYS Mechanical, Creo Parametric, or other 3D modelling and FEA software

Benefits
  • Extended Healthcare Plan (Medical, Disability, Dental & Vision)
  • Paid Time Off Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program - Counseling
  • Hybrid/Flexible Work Arrangements Available
  • Wellness Reimbursement Subsidy Program

We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Terrestrial Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected status.

If you require accommodation during the application or interview process, please advise us as soon as possible so appropriate arrangements can be made. If you require technical support in a format that is accessible to you, please contact Human Resources at AODA@terrestrialenergy.com.

The Mechanical Design Engineer, under the direction of the Mechanical Engineering Manager, is primarily responsible for design and development of their responsible mechanical systems through the Basic Engineering phase. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a truly innovative advanced reactor design, the IMSR. Other responsibilities include:
  • Develop passive and active thermal management and heat transfer design solutions in accordance with applicable design guides, procedures, and codes & standards
  • Provide expertise in selection, design and performance of pumps, valves, heat exchangers, tanks and vessels, including overpressure protection
  • Prepare calculations (thermodynamics, heat transfer, fluid dynamics, heat mass balance, equipment sizing, etc.), analyses and assessment documents for the development of complex mechanical and fluid systems and components
  • Design piping systems including line sizing and pressure drop calculations
  • Prepare design plans, system classifications, design requirements and other design documentation in accordance with applicable design guides, procedures, and codes & standards
  • Incorporate methodologies to facilitate constructability, commissioning, operability, maintainability, inspectability, testability and decommissioning
  • Collaborate with the Thermal Hydraulics Team for execution of detailed thermal hydraulics modelling and CFD simulations
  • Prepare and/or review Design Change Packages
  • Contribute to the material selection and qualification processes as part of the Terrestrial Energy Research & Development (R&D) program
  • Identify needed R&D work and any associated testing or other validation and verification activities. Prepare or support the preparation of test plans
  • Coordinate and interface with the plant layout lead in the development of 3D CAD models and 2D engineering drawings for the responsible mechanical systems
  • Coordinate with other interfacing disciplines such as Electrical, I&C, Civil, etc...
  • Oversee and collaborate with external vendors, and carry-out vendor deliverable reviews
  • Contribute to timely resolution of mechanical design challenges and address risks
  • Conduct presentations to interdisciplinary teams and external parties
  • Provide technical guidance and leadership to other engineers or EITs

Core Competencies
  • Communication
  • Critical Thinking
  • Decision Making
  • Leadership
  • Problem Solving
  • Results Orientation
  • Teamwork & Collaboration
  • Flexible and Adaptable

Requirements
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in Mechanical Engineering, or alternate degree in a related field
  • Registered Professional Engineering in Ontario
  • Minimum 8 years of work experience in the design of mechanical, fluid, and heat transfer systems and components, preferably in the nuclear industry
  • Strong mechanical aptitude. Track record of innovative contributions to design and demonstrated success in project delivery. Experienced in preparation of design documentation (e.g. design plans, system classifications, design requirements, flow diagrams, design change packages etc)
  • Experience in selection, design and performance of pumps, valves, heat exchangers, tanks and vessels, including overpressure protection
  • Strong knowledge in power plant systems, thermodynamics, fluid dynamics, heat transfer, heat and mass balance, overpressure protection, and mechanics of materials
  • Expert ability to design systems and components to achieve desired Thermal Hydraulic requirements, and experience in preparing supporting calculations (thermodynamics, heat transfer, fluid dynamics, heat mass balance, equipment sizing, etc.)
  • Experience in preparation of test plans is an asset
  • Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills
  • Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines
  • Strong communication (both written and verbal) skills
  • Skilled at developing and maintaining strong relationships across all levels of the organization and with external customers and vendors

Assets
  • Industry experience in the Nuclear Power, Small Modular Reactors, and/or Solar Plants (molten salt)
  • Expert or working knowledge of nuclear pressure boundary codes including ASME Section III Division 1 and Division 5, CSA N285.0
  • Working knowledge of ANSYS Mechanical, Creo Parametric, or other 3D modelling and FEA software

Benefits
  • Extended Healthcare Plan (Medical, Disability, Dental & Vision)
  • Paid Time Off Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program - Counseling
  • Hybrid/Flexible Work Arrangements Available
  • Wellness Reimbursement Subsidy Program

We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Terrestrial Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected status.

If you require accommodation during the application or interview process, please advise us as soon as possible so appropriate arrangements can be made. If you require technical support in a format that is accessible to you, please contact Human Resources at AODA@terrestrialenergy.com.

title: Mechanical Engineer, Aerospace
description:
The Mechanical Design Engineer, under the direction of the Mechanical Engineering Manager, is primarily responsible for design and development of their responsible mechanical systems through the Basic Engineering phase. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a truly innovative advanced reactor design, the IMSR. Other responsibilities include:
  • Develop passive and active thermal management and heat transfer design solutions in accordance with applicable design guides, procedures, and codes & standards
  • Provide expertise in selection, design and performance of pumps, valves, heat exchangers, tanks and vessels, including overpressure protection
  • Prepare calculations (thermodynamics, heat transfer, fluid dynamics, heat mass balance, equipment sizing, etc.), analyses and assessment documents for the development of complex mechanical and fluid systems and components
  • Design piping systems including line sizing and pressure drop calculations
  • Prepare design plans, system classifications, design requirements and other design documentation in accordance with applicable design guides, procedures, and codes & standards
  • Incorporate methodologies to facilitate constructability, commissioning, operability, maintainability, inspectability, testability and decommissioning
  • Collaborate with the Thermal Hydraulics Team for execution of detailed thermal hydraulics modelling and CFD simulations
  • Prepare and/or review Design Change Packages
  • Contribute to the material selection and qualification processes as part of the Terrestrial Energy Research & Development (R&D) program
  • Identify needed R&D work and any associated testing or other validation and verification activities. Prepare or support the preparation of test plans
  • Coordinate and interface with the plant layout lead in the development of 3D CAD models and 2D engineering drawings for the responsible mechanical systems
  • Coordinate with other interfacing disciplines such as Electrical, I&C, Civil, etc...
  • Oversee and collaborate with external vendors, and carry-out vendor deliverable reviews
  • Contribute to timely resolution of mechanical design challenges and address risks
  • Conduct presentations to interdisciplinary teams and external parties
  • Provide technical guidance and leadership to other engineers or EITs

Core Competencies
  • Communication
  • Critical Thinking
  • Decision Making
  • Leadership
  • Problem Solving
  • Results Orientation
  • Teamwork & Collaboration
  • Flexible and Adaptable

Requirements
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in Mechanical Engineering, or alternate degree in a related field
  • Registered Professional Engineering in Ontario
  • Minimum 8 years of work experience in the design of mechanical, fluid, and heat transfer systems and components, preferably in the nuclear industry
  • Strong mechanical aptitude. Track record of innovative contributions to design and demonstrated success in project delivery. Experienced in preparation of design documentation (e.g. design plans, system classifications, design requirements, flow diagrams, design change packages etc)
  • Experience in selection, design and performance of pumps, valves, heat exchangers, tanks and vessels, including overpressure protection
  • Strong knowledge in power plant systems, thermodynamics, fluid dynamics, heat transfer, heat and mass balance, overpressure protection, and mechanics of materials
  • Expert ability to design systems and components to achieve desired Thermal Hydraulic requirements, and experience in preparing supporting calculations (thermodynamics, heat transfer, fluid dynamics, heat mass balance, equipment sizing, etc.)
  • Experience in preparation of test plans is an asset
  • Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills
  • Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines
  • Strong communication (both written and verbal) skills
  • Skilled at developing and maintaining strong relationships across all levels of the organization and with external customers and vendors

Assets
  • Industry experience in the Nuclear Power, Small Modular Reactors, and/or Solar Plants (molten salt)
  • Expert or working knowledge of nuclear pressure boundary codes including ASME Section III Division 1 and Division 5, CSA N285.0
  • Working knowledge of ANSYS Mechanical, Creo Parametric, or other 3D modelling and FEA software

Benefits
  • Extended Healthcare Plan (Medical, Disability, Dental & Vision)
  • Paid Time Off Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program - Counseling
  • Hybrid/Flexible Work Arrangements Available
  • Wellness Reimbursement Subsidy Program

We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Terrestrial Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected status.

If you require accommodation during the application or interview process, please advise us as soon as possible so appropriate arrangements can be made. If you require technical support in a format that is accessible to you, please contact Human Resources at AODA@terrestrialenergy.com.

The Mechanical Design Engineer, under the direction of the Mechanical Engineering Manager, is primarily responsible for design and development of their responsible mechanical systems through the Basic Engineering phase. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a truly innovative advanced reactor design, the IMSR. Other responsibilities include:
  • Develop passive and active thermal management and heat transfer design solutions in accordance with applicable design guides, procedures, and codes & standards
  • Provide expertise in selection, design and performance of pumps, valves, heat exchangers, tanks and vessels, including overpressure protection
  • Prepare calculations (thermodynamics, heat transfer, fluid dynamics, heat mass balance, equipment sizing, etc.), analyses and assessment documents for the development of complex mechanical and fluid systems and components
  • Design piping systems including line sizing and pressure drop calculations
  • Prepare design plans, system classifications, design requirements and other design documentation in accordance with applicable design guides, procedures, and codes & standards
  • Incorporate methodologies to facilitate constructability, commissioning, operability, maintainability, inspectability, testability and decommissioning
  • Collaborate with the Thermal Hydraulics Team for execution of detailed thermal hydraulics modelling and CFD simulations
  • Prepare and/or review Design Change Packages
  • Contribute to the material selection and qualification processes as part of the Terrestrial Energy Research & Development (R&D) program
  • Identify needed R&D work and any associated testing or other validation and verification activities. Prepare or support the preparation of test plans
  • Coordinate and interface with the plant layout lead in the development of 3D CAD models and 2D engineering drawings for the responsible mechanical systems
  • Coordinate with other interfacing disciplines such as Electrical, I&C, Civil, etc...
  • Oversee and collaborate with external vendors, and carry-out vendor deliverable reviews
  • Contribute to timely resolution of mechanical design challenges and address risks
  • Conduct presentations to interdisciplinary teams and external parties
  • Provide technical guidance and leadership to other engineers or EITs

Core Competencies
  • Communication
  • Critical Thinking
  • Decision Making
  • Leadership
  • Problem Solving
  • Results Orientation
  • Teamwork & Collaboration
  • Flexible and Adaptable

Requirements
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in Mechanical Engineering, or alternate degree in a related field
  • Registered Professional Engineering in Ontario
  • Minimum 8 years of work experience in the design of mechanical, fluid, and heat transfer systems and components, preferably in the nuclear industry
  • Strong mechanical aptitude. Track record of innovative contributions to design and demonstrated success in project delivery. Experienced in preparation of design documentation (e.g. design plans, system classifications, design requirements, flow diagrams, design change packages etc)
  • Experience in selection, design and performance of pumps, valves, heat exchangers, tanks and vessels, including overpressure protection
  • Strong knowledge in power plant systems, thermodynamics, fluid dynamics, heat transfer, heat and mass balance, overpressure protection, and mechanics of materials
  • Expert ability to design systems and components to achieve desired Thermal Hydraulic requirements, and experience in preparing supporting calculations (thermodynamics, heat transfer, fluid dynamics, heat mass balance, equipment sizing, etc.)
  • Experience in preparation of test plans is an asset
  • Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills
  • Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines
  • Strong communication (both written and verbal) skills
  • Skilled at developing and maintaining strong relationships across all levels of the organization and with external customers and vendors

Assets
  • Industry experience in the Nuclear Power, Small Modular Reactors, and/or Solar Plants (molten salt)
  • Expert or working knowledge of nuclear pressure boundary codes including ASME Section III Division 1 and Division 5, CSA N285.0
  • Working knowledge of ANSYS Mechanical, Creo Parametric, or other 3D modelling and FEA software

Benefits
  • Extended Healthcare Plan (Medical, Disability, Dental & Vision)
  • Paid Time Off Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program - Counseling
  • Hybrid/Flexible Work Arrangements Available
  • Wellness Reimbursement Subsidy Program

We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Terrestrial Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected status.

If you require accommodation during the application or interview process, please advise us as soon as possible so appropriate arrangements can be made. If you require technical support in a format that is accessible to you, please contact Human Resources at AODA@terrestrialenergy.com.
